iG8yfmSPl1JrqiC6ky88Sw.text: Look. The Pho is pretty good, but the service is awful. It's 1:08 and I still haven't received the coffee I ordered at 12:12. The place has one other guest so busy really doesn't qualify as an excuse for your delay. Our checks took over 20 minutes to get, one guy had to ask 3 times for his beer. On top of that, they put 12 customers on our receipt so that our group of 6 was charged gratuity (probably good because our waitress did not deserve a tip). I'm extra pissed because your staff failed to clean up the stickiness on and under my seat, and my shoes now are permanently sticky. Don't know that we will be back.

RI40Tv4TS9EYSl6odEy5Yw.text: Nice place with decent Asian food. Pho Cao is mainly a bar that also serves food. Good staff that seems to care about their patrons.  Wish they'd cut back on the garlic and use better quality chicken parts (i.e. Only use chicken breasts).

PaGOy7icLMirs-Pvi7qkIQ.text: Passed by this place several times after recently moving to the area. Looked like it had a good amount of business most days so it must be good. I was sadly mistaken...  The decor in this place is a bit of an eyesore. There is a bar, some tables and booths, a pool area, what looks like stage for live music or karaoke. Very dimly lit and dirty/grungy feeling.   Our waitress was very odd as well. Not very friendly and didn't seem to have any knowledge of the menu. When asking questions about it she didn't really have an answer. The food is not very good and is an odd mix of Vietnamese, and American Chinese. Every thing the pit group ordered was just bland and lacked any creativity.  Probably won't be coming back...

4bWQtKYXTBKVH5Kfmk2CDg.text: Great food and live music! Beer selection is just ok, but menu has many great choices. Gets pretty loud if you're not into live music. Definitely recommend!

FZb8yfJBPxkif36H4dGELQ.text: 8.50 for a regular bowl of Pho and 2.50 for a coke!!! Uh... How about no? After tip I spent $14. The pho here isn't even that great because the meat was odd tasting. Service was okay in that it was fast, but the ambiance of this place is off-putting. I was hesitant to come here, but not coming back because of price and atmosphere (and I came when it was quite).

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pricey af!!!

GVSzVmqtGZMKhMoji7nY-g.text: Let's start with it took ten minutes for us to be noticed by the one server there. The manager or what ever informed us that she was the only one working. We then received menus and ordered our food and drinks. We got a sake bomber which was cold sake served in a dirty glass. The glass was dirty so we showed it to the bartender and she gave us a new one which was still cold. We have never been served cold sake before so we weren't really sure what was up with that. We then got our food. The six dollar spring rolls were definitely not worth it. Just lettuce with a STOP of pork wrapped in rice paper. The pho was actually really good! We are our food the bartender was noticeably over whelmed forgetting my drink order but brought it right when I reminded her. Then we get the check. Keep in mind it was happy hour. Never have I been charged separately for beer and sake. 8 dollars all together. And my little 8 ounce mixed drink was nine dollars. When I showed her these were not happy hour prices she said they didn't have happy hour on weekends. It was Thursday. She then told us it was happy hour prices. Um 9 dollars a drink for happy hour?!? Needless to say I was not happy with my experience here and will not be coming back. Yes the pho was good, but pho than is better with better service. I would not waste your time here I felt like I was on AND episode of bar rescue.

UMDV6ZErROG7voeuexInzA.text: My friend invited me to Pho Cao- thought it was going to be a sit down restaurant-- was surprised when i came and saw it was a bar with a live band! They were playing the beatles! Loved it. The food was pretty good, my friend had pho, I had spring rolls which were delicious! Our server Erin made sure we were taken care of. Thank you Erin!

VHq3ZDCEhgUpFrJuXRCYkA.text: Pho with live blues playing was a bit odd.. I spent most of my time there look to see if John Tapper from Bar Rescue was going to walk in.. The food was average at best.

NbQNVfymXxjIi89S9xE2QQ.text: I wanted to try this place because my cousin's band has played here before and I thought it would be good because he played there regularly. They never answer their phone for takeout, finally they did months later and I was able to place an order. I got the vegetarian curry for 9.99 and it came with a total of three pieces of tofu, three pieces of potato, and three carrots. Other people weren't joking around about how badly they skimp on the food. The potato and carrot tasted very mushy and soggy, almost like it was super old and from some leftover stew or something and had been sitting out all day.       Overall the curry was very bad and probably the worst I've had in the area, for the same price I can get a real curry down the street. The garlic noodles were very stale/dry and stuck together and smelled like mushrooms too. I asked for thai tea and they said there wasn't any ready. So what, you can't brew more? I'm thankful I don't eat meat either, because a lot of people report getting food poisoning from here. I won't be eating here again, it's disgusting and they're clearly so greedy they can't spare more than three pieces of tofu for a basic vegetarian dish. I did not go in myself, but the person who did said it looked like a filthy dive bar and smelled really musty.

vyf5L_Xd_xkKYSxCrH8sPQ.text: Love the Buddha spring rolls. Best peanut sauce I have ever had. Crispy noodles hit the spot but my recommendation is to ask for extra sauce because it is delicious.   Couple days ago I had the veggie pho and it was wonderful The main reason that I came back decides the kettle one mule which was one of the best mules I ever had

eYInrKu2GV_vws1ZNMsc-g.text: I would have given them a 2 stars but the waiter was kind and I came to this place once before when I Was out of town in January and it was delicious. This time I came and the vermicelli I ordered the lettuce and bean sprouts were wilted and brown. I still eat, because service took forever and I Was starving from traveling. But I kindly notified the waiter to notify the chef. I do not know if I come back again if I'm in Scottsdale...

tG2LNtZKp5r-jFzFLP5zqQ.text: Missed the band.  Flat beer.  No roses lime juice.  Great staff and a cool crowd.  Wish WWF got here earlier.  Will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Main bar.  Awesome staff!

ZIkC2vC0oemMslyjzC4_BA.text: Comfortable atmosphere and Great Vietnamese food!!  Their Pho broth is one of the best I've had in town, and is always so fresh and delicious.  Besides the pho, the also have some fantastic rice dishes.  The Shaken Beef (Bo Luc Lac) is incredible; chopped cubes of filet mignon cooked with onions and peppers.  The sliced BBQ Pork and Grilled Shrimp plate is excellent as well.  I'd also recommend saving some room for dessert and get the Coconut ice cream, which they serve in a fresh coconut with a chilled glass of the Coconut milk on the side.  If you'd like a new Vietnamese restaurant, look no further .

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Coconut ice cream served inside a fresh Coconut, and the Fried Banana with vanilla ice cream

ErAjOqMQE0lPBVOoGnV7hA.text: I am so happy Pho Cao opened right down the street from me.  Came in a few weeks ago and wasnt sure if they had opened yet.  They were still working on some construction inside but totally let me order Beef Pho (which I highly recommend)  They could have told me they were closed and to piss off but they were awesome!  Flavor was delicious and will be going back very soon... probably tonight because now i'm craving it.   I am giving this 3 stars because its a little confusing where the front door is and the inside could use some work.  Definitely need to change the lighting and the layout.  It looks like they put tables around randomly, just looks a little more of a dive bar than vietnamese - but I go for the food.  Keeping the 3 star rating but totally bummed with my last experience. I love getting take out from here and placed an order Sunday for dinner and went to pick it up and they didn't have my order and were less than helpful or apologetic. They just kept asking if I was Stan ... Do I look like a Stan?  Update: Came here for dinner and they had their live music - OMG THIS WAS AWFUL.  They had the volume on the absolute highest volume and the people who were signing were actually awful and painful to listen to.  I could not have a conversation or even think.  I do like their broth and think they give a good portion of meat compared to a lot of other places but I will only ever get take out - DO NOT EAT INSIDE unless you want your ears to bleed.

qXZxptQUOpDX-_tL5ezcNg.text: Amazing pho and the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. Everyone says it's a weird atmosphere but I love it because it's different, it's jazz music in a bar atmosphere with amazing food you can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best pho in town

a-0T2ZE5x4dYT2ENuRwBjA.text: Service: I thought the server was overall friendly but not that attentive and definitely exaggerated everything I was considering on the menu. I gave a star for the friendly server.  Food: Definitely overpriced and extremely small portions. First I ordered my absolute favorite meal: bun bo hue large ($10) and it was just OK. It is supposed to be spicy and filled with meat but this thing had a few meatballs and beef. It was a huge disappointment.  So still starving, decided to order Cao's Special Fried Rice ($12) because it's supposedly large. It came out dry AF and flavorless, and again very small quantity. It was probably a left over honestly. I really wanted to complain but didn't want to wait for another dish because I was already there alone for about 45 minutes and didn't want to cause trouble.   Atmosphere: Outdated  Conclusion: Mind you, I am a 160lb dude who goes out to eat all the time at Vietnamese/Asian restaurants. I'm new to the area so I'm not sure if they're the only ones in town. If they are, I'm going to be sad not being able to get Viet food for a while.

jKYAo5N2SR18JzdFzzDZdQ.text: I'm here right now. It's my first time. My friends took me her for my birthday. Service was great! Food was okay. Being Vietnamese everything tasted on the bland side.. The main reason why I gave this place a 2 star is we came here on Thursday for karaoke .. You write your name on a list to wait in line. I got a chance to sing my song and my friends we right behind me on the list but for some reason they didn't get to sing after me.. So I was confused.. I believe the DJ for the karaoke puts up people he know and regulars first before us.. Which is a totally unfair and bias. I don't get how a restaurant will gain new regulars when they do this to new people. Probably will be my first and last time here. Was a fun spot til that happened. :/

YApStyVWgx1yYpYDNkWCjA.text: Don't waste your time ordering from BeyondMenu (to order take out online). 44JX6AdwuMitGRsaAZavYQ.text: Yum. We've been here twice now and absolutely love the food.  We tried another place down the street and it was SO bland and boring - Pho Cao's food is all extremely flavorful.  Serving sizes are generous, prices are decent, and the food is amazing.  Surf and turf pho is our favorite! I did dock a star because it's very dive-y.  They have fairly loud local acts and open mic nights and it's very dark in there for dinner.  If you can deal with that, though (which I recommend), the food is spectacular and service is above average.

Zk6Gu8KDm28ZgsMvmhvwTQ.text: This restaurant has remarkable good food and we enjoy the convenience of takeout. We've tried crispy and spring rolls and a few varieties of pho. Very tasty, worth coming back for...

l_dqmArribiKOC2lVuhWHA.text: It was good enjoyed the pho and it was a little to quite for my taste.. would like some music.. but was awesome enjoyed lunch here..

U38Cg9aEQrTWa60iI5UlHA.text: I pulled in to grab a few Banh Mi sandwiches usually $5.00 a sandwich some places buy 4-5 get 1 free. This place was almost $9 per sandwich and it was Chinese food meat converted to a Banh Mi use. Almost  every Vietnamese restaurant from here to Albany NY uses fresh French rolls that have a slight crust letting you know FRESH and good this was rather small and tough like delivered every 3-4 days it's a Portuguese roll not real French bread roll that has becomes fusion staple the Pickled radishes and cuts oversized just a real poor copy at a high price. The Pho looked good at each customer table but ordered something else as I was traveling and needed something road worthy I didn't get Vietnamese or Thai I got bad Chinese. Sorry maybe if you've never had good Vietnamese or Thai you'll like it but this was imitation crab on king crab tab. Try the place on Bell and 42 ave roughly always crowded and they most expensive item on menu is $11.99 and Banh Mi are $5 and bread is fresh everyday it's delicious. When it's packed from lunch to 9 pm with Asian diners you've got a good product.

M89_9--G9xPaZ-N7uNcgcQ.text: I've had this place bookmarked for awhile, but it took a coworker's ravings for the pho here for me to finally drop in and see what it's all about.  (He told me that the owners are coworkers from another department.)  I read a couple of yelp friends' reviews, and I agree with Kay T.'s opinion that the restaurant is a dive bar.  Upon entering the place, I was disappointed to see that it really was a dive bar, but I wasn't surprised to find the atmosphere as it is, since another coworker's attempt at owning a bar (this was ten years ago) had the same atmosphere.  It's just a place where people can go after work, still in their black undershirts and black pants, and get a buzz on, or get wasted.  Thankfully, the steak pho I tried here was delicious!  $7.50 for the regular-size bowl, plus add $2.50 for tendon option.  I could even order veggies (bok choy, broccoli, carrot, and something else; important thing is that one may ask for any of these ingredients omitted-- great for those with food allergies!) for an extra $2.  For drink options, the Thai iced tea was too pricey ($4, and the restaurant didn't have any to sell), and an order of Vietnamese coffee was $5 (!!).  So far, this dive served food and Asian beverages sounded a little pricey for a place I hadn't tried, yet, so I just went with pho and added tendons.  The side dish of sprouts, sprigs of cilantro and mint, and lime arrived first, and seeing how small it was, I knew that the bowl with also be smaller than I'm used to.  And it was, but oh, so tasty!  The slices of steak was tender; a nice amount of tendon cuts added more textures; and a good amount of egg noodles.  I must preface that I'd skipped the second "meal" I'd normally have at work in order to have room for this pho meal, so perhaps I was so hungry, anything would taste great.  All I can report is that this is the very first bowl of pho where I ate everything- steak pieces, all of the sprouts on that side dish, egg noodles, AND tendon pieces!  The only thing left was a bit of soup.  Had that soup not been so salty, I probably would've consumed half of what was eventually left over...  Afterwards, I did feel that the soup had a LOT of sodium in it, and my face felt swollen, so I think the broth may even have MSG in it, and if Pho Cao uses MSG, I won't be able to return for a second tasting.  Based on that first bowl of pho, I would like to take my mom here, since she also enjoys a great bowl of pho.  (We'll just split a large order.)  She's a lot tougher a judge than me, though, since she knows how much it costs to make a broth meal (food shopping, costs, and preparation time).  I just know that upon seeing and feeling the ambiance of the place, she will ask me to take her somewhere else-- I don't blame her, I almost left without dining here myself!  If I'm right about the MSG, I won't have a reason to return.  The female bartender that served me was friendly, and the male server that handled the one table I saw occupied was, as well.  Happy hour is served from 3p to 6p.  I didn't ask if there was reverse happy hour.  Given the area, though, I wouldn't want to be there that late in the evening.

5WO9-ziFYr2Ammn-IZDThQ.text: I love this spot! I think I have reviewed but I have to mention again!  This is dive bar that has a Vietnamese feel, awesome musical performances and Vietnamese karaoke night! Amazing drinks and hands-down the best vegan Pho broth out there!!! Always amazing and fast service! Britney is the sweetest and most welcoming! Sage is amazing too!  Thanks PhoCao !!!!!!!!

jMdiqOg5cW-OvbxJxKlQiw.text: I really like it here.  My partner and I are both vegans and we come here frequently for Pho and sometimes the curry and sometimes the vegan hot pot.  The vegan springrolls are great, and the budda rolls.  The place is cute with good service and fun drinks.  They typically have live music and it is usually nice.  Sometimes the music is too loud to have dinner conversation, so we usually only come if we just feel like chilling and not talking much.

q647DM4fXEZYx2JJzVb0Kw.text: This is by far my favorite Pho place in all of Scottsdale and Phoenix! I had the ramen Pho and it was perfect this is the only place that I heard of that offers ramen noodles in pho broth. I have had a lot of Pho and the broth here is fantastic. Basil, lime, sprouts, onions, and cilantro were so fresh it looks like they picked the herbs right before they sent it out the door. Awesome customer service and the food was delivered hot and 30min before expected. Thank you to Pho Cao and doordash for an amazing experience!

wHotIRrdFTf1fPgbdTYafw.text: We were in the area and craving Pho. I found this on Yelp and saw decent reviews. I should have known better the moment we drove up that it wasn't good news.  When we walked in, it was straight up a bar atmosphere with a stage for live music.  It was dark, dingy and I don't know why we didn't just turn around and walk back out, but alas my son was hungry so we stayed and hoped for the best.  There was 1 server and about 3 tables that had patrons.  Our server tried his best, but it was so lackluster.  He never checked on us and we repeatedly had to ask for stuff.  Oh...and what's the point of memorizing what we order when you have to come back 2 times to ask us again what it was we ordered, and then a 3rd and 4th time for us to remind you that you've forgotten to bring us what we ordered.  The pho was terrible.  Three of us ordered it and my husband took a sip of the broth and pushed it aside and couldn't bare to eat any more of it.  My older son ate half because like I said, he was hungry, and my youngest just ate the noodles.  The spring rolls had no meat or shrimp but was completely overstuffed with shredded lettuce.  Ugh. I was so disappointed with this place.  We ended up leaving hungry because we couldn't finish our meals.

I was surprised that it's so big inside as well As the stage they have inside! The nice waiter told me they have ladies night & karaoke nights . I was happy to hear that  and would bring my friends in! Now the food.... was delicious!!! The pho I got was large and I ate the left overs as a snack. I highly recommend this place!

Not of the restaurant, the service was good and a live band, but I'm not a fan of Pho. I'm sure it's great but not for me. Try it out maybe you'll like it more than me.

VpfGueLzVSdD4b7jUvoeaw.text: It's ok. It doesn't feel like a pho place... more like a noisy dive bar. I mean, if you are into that then it's fine. I just like that it's open late and serves pho. Recently I had the ramen pho and it wasn't bad. I was expecting it to be terrible, but it wasn't!  Service was bad though. We waited 45 minutes before we got our food. The waiter cited that they were busy, but seriously? 45 minutes to dump some broth onto the noodles? Oh well.  I give it 3 stars because it's open late and it's not terrible pho. However, during the day, I'm heading to my usual pho place that's $4 cheaper, have better meat portions, faster service, and better tasting pho.

4pE3QVvPSYIjPvz7e7vzZQ.text: Love this hole in the wall, late night open, yummy pho place. This place is great for a hangover. There are no windows in the place - full bar - and it's got fast and friendly service. In the evenings there's live music of all kinds which is always fun and interesting! (Except for Monday's) The Tamarind broth is super good if your looking to spice up your pho experience! It's spicy!  This place is great to go just by yourself or with a big group.

huWjQ0D55njSU44HC2DIuw.text: The atmosphere:  This is a hip little pho place. There was live music the evening we went. It was a variety of different genres. If you're looking for a quiet atmosphere, I'd recommend checking to see if they have live music that night. We went on a Sunday evening, and it was not ideal for conversation.   The food: The pho is awesome! If you're a vegan/vegetarian they have great options (including vegan broth), and the veggie pho has great flavor. The other pho variants were liked in the group as well. If you're a bloody Mary fan, they put a Vietnamese twist on it, and I highly recommend it. If you're looking for a pho place, look no further.   The service: In general the wait staff was pleasant, polite and eager to help. It seemed as though they were understaffed, but the servers were all accommodating and apologetic for the delays. Hopefully it was just an issue of being down a server.  In summary, great pho, hipster vibe (may not be great for conversation depending on the evening), service was ok.

vCQHfaF5SgzSvVEO8AFk-g.text: Pretty good! Hit the spot! super friendly. Bonus egg rolls or potstickers. Bonus drink. Vietnamese ice coffee was strong and perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

r3dHcV7UA-V-ER_fkBYl8A.text: Here is the best part...open on Sunday.  The other PHO joints around here are closed.

E8e1uD9up-BERjmPY-mmlg.text: I work late sometimes and I have a hard time finding a place that will cater to the night owl such as myself.   Pho Cao was convenient and stayed open late. Their menu was vast and delicious. Darina, or waitress, was on point with making sure our experience was the best that it could be. She made sure our drinks were filled and our empty plates cleared.  Their Pho was great being seasoned to perfection.   I will be visiting this place more and broaden my palate with the rest of their menu.

J0_ZVlGF6vFMS6e99sPHBA.text: This is the best pho for such a great price! I love the spicy tamarind broth. The other crazy thing is they have live music and karaoke and such things, making it a very unique pho joint! Shoutout to Lucas who took care of us today. Today was my third time. And my first time being taken care of by Lucas. He was super attentive and knowledgeable about the menu! He was just all around a genuinely awesome and gave fantastic rare service. Cheers!

uXtc7ElTuLO6Ak2faQwN8g.text: Love this place. The staff is great, food is amazing, and the price is reasonable. Win win win

ytnNiaXoUhbgM9ZRUUEWoA.text: Be prepared for live music with full bands either on or closer to the weekend. If you're looking for a nice quiet pho place to take your family or sweetie, not exactly the place. The broth is a little sweeter and all the add-ins are fresh.

CXLEB9D-ozyXlCIUDiakew.text: Why in the world would they automate the menu on their website to scroll every 10 seconds. It seems like they ought to fire their web coder. Couldn't decide what to eat because everytime I'm reading the menu items, it's changing the menu page on me. So just decided to go to Saigon Bowl, their menu doesn't skip out on me as I'm trying to make a selection.

Q3tc0ihpinzbrtvZbZ1hzg.text: Not all pho restaurants are created equal and this place is no exception.  I can't complain though.  The servings are big and very filing. Atmosphere is kind of dark with black and orange painted walls but i can't rate them on the color of their walls everyone has different taste.  All in all this place is good I will be returning..oh!  And about pho soup being great for colds and hangovers. .this is so very True.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great for colds and hangovers

1MoHbosKsxgidnI2I1DNGQ.text: I'm extremely forgiving (check out my other reviews--I'm the picture of positivity), but I'm seriously wondering if to-go orders here are filed away in the garbage can. The pho and food are good, the problem is the service. If my order is messed up the first time--ok, it wasn't a great night. Second time--oops--maybe they're training new people? Three times? WTF is happening? Do you hate me? I went to pick up my order after 45 minutes and found out that it had never been submitted. Yikes. You just can't phock with hangry people like that.

rdM5OqHT4p1f8RW5uAk6mw.text: Not only great food but our server Edwin was funny and showed us a great time! I definitely am coming back with the guys again!

yjpzNxWQpBKROzPD8Dbfng.text: The food was absolutely amazing , had a really good dinner before catching a movie on a Saturday night.  The waiter was great and attentive on refilling our waters , plus the food came fast , which was great because I was starving! They play good relaxing music with good ambulance .... Highly recommend coming here! Will deff be coming back soon :)

FkgsTzYpK9MJS7xqvIQQYQ.text: We love the Bun  Bo Hue, or spicy beef noodle soup. If you like pho, you have to try this. Thicker noodles, darker spicier broth, and it has a mixture of meets.  The fried egg rolls are bomb! But most Vietnamese egg rolls are bomb, so what can I say.  They have a Bo Luc Lac dish, or shaken beef thats pretty good. I would rate it a 3 of 5 because Ive had better. Its a little too sweet for my palate.

KVHoM4hxTP_wP5XqdJ6JGw.text: I came here for lunch with a friend. I ordered their Pho Gah. The atmosphere is similar to a dive bar atmosphere, not your typical Pho place. I read other reviews ahead of time saying this but took the chance since the first Pho option we wanted was closed.   When we walked in a server/hostess told us to sit anywhere we'd like. Every booth seemed to have an empty glass or finished plate (about 3 or 4 empty booths like this) besides those currently occupied. We opted for a two person table instead. One of our chairs was sticky and so was the menu.   The food itself was ok. I judge Pho by the chicken, this chicken seemed liked it was canned and not fresh. They do serve coconuts though, if you are thirsty or Jasmine tea. That is if you don't want alcohol from the bar. I ordered tea, but I didn't realize they planned on bringing it cold when I prefer hot. Though, I wasn't asked a preference either way.   I would eat here again, it's just not my first choice for Pho.

EYXQoD-_jc4pjVhDYM-Img.text: I absolutely love this restaurant because I am able to order pho with vegetable with a vegetable based broth. The servers are always full of energy and knowledgeable. The best part is they serve incredibly late and they are located next to Bosa Donuts, so if you need something sweet you can head next foor

GZqgWMmYknOZzacQlPFBKw.text: First impression....I keep expecting to look up and see John Taffer charging in with the camera crew to shoot an episode of "Bar Rescue".... Oh my god.  Came here with the idea of having Vietnamese food, but I think I made a huge mistake! Its dark, dingy, and there's a speaker directly above the table blaring reggae at me (the server said she'd turn it down, but hasn't happened yet...).  Mkay.  My first reaction is to run for the door. (I should have!) We split an order of spring rolls as an appetizer, well more of a side dish since it came out with everything else.  Very disappointing at $6-- mostly brown lettuce inside.  I could only choke down half of one, and no one was interested in the other half.  Oh, I seriously should have gone! I ordered the combo fried rice ($12) because it was the most reasonably priced entree and I felt it wouldn't make me sick.  The rest of the menu was too outrageously over priced for me to consider ($15 for stir fried beef w/onions and bell peppers? $13 for sort of pork chop and rice? Really?!). Again, I should have just said no.  It was ok, but I was not about to touch those three partially deveined, partially shelled, rubbery shrimp! Ew! The tv dinner pea/carrot mix is kind of expected (but usually at a much lower price point!). The quantity was sufficient, but that may have had more to do with my loss of appetite than anything else.   Top it off with $2.75 for a glass of diet coke, and you can call me less than thrilled about my experience here today. I've said before, I don't mind paying a little more for quality.  When I'm charged quality prices and you don't deliver, I get pissed.  This was $35 for a pretty bad lunch.  I work hard for my money and I don't like wasting it. So unless you're going in as the mole for "Bar Rescue"-- take my advice and run.  Run for the door and get in your car! Don't look back! Just go.

ur8zfKBCbAjgvOxIRpj-SQ.text: I was driving one day and noticed that Pho Cao is now in the neighborhood. Being constantly on the lookout for something new, I went in for lunch. Service was friendly, I was seated immediately, and I spent some time studying the menu.  I really wanted to like this place...  The restaurant itself is sort of dark and heavy with the dark walls and dark unfinished floor, and there is nothing to diminish the noise that reverberates off the walls and floor. I knew that if I returned here, it wouldn't be for the setting.  The server did check with me several times before I was ready to order, but I was glad he was paying attention. I decided on E17, Charbroiled pork and eggroll with vermicelli. The dish was very bland, and I found myself trying to flavor it up with Hoisin and Soy Sauce. That didn't work very well, so when I finally got someone's attention, I paid, and left most of my food behind. All though they weren't very busy, no one seemed concerned enough to ask me how my food was.   I decided a few days later to give it another try, that perhaps I should have guessed E17 would be bland. I wanted to like this place.   I entered, and was struck once again by the lack of atmosphere of any sort. it just feels like a big dive. This time I ordered two things to be fair, and I stuck with items I had read good things about in their ratings. I ordered the A5 Fried Chicken Pot stickers, and the P2 Steak Pho and sat back ready to have a better meal than on my previous visit.   The Pot Stickers were a generous portion, but the filling didn't offer up much flavor, and the dipping sauce just came off flat, not really enhancing the fried dumpling, the outside of which was hard rather than crisp. The Pho also didn't yield much flavor, even with all of the fresh ingredients added.  The portions were generous, but without any richness of flavor, I just got tired of eating and requested my check. I'll note that just as on my first visit, no one ever checked back after delivering my food to me to see if it was to my liking.  A further challenge on my second visit was that a young family of about 8 came in with their small child. In addition to the loudness of their voices in the room with nothing to break the sound, the squalling child, who they made no attempt to placate or entertain, completed my experience of - no, I don't need to try this again.  Maybe I'm getting it all backwards, and being open for lunch is done on a whim, and they really want to be a loud, fun evening entertainment venue that happens to have food. The concept may have alluded me. I'm sorry I couldn't like it.   The food wasn't horrible. Everything was very fresh. It just wasn't that tasty.  Also, at no point during either visit did I smell any food cooking.

PaVvmDsCxPpq3azAMJYABQ.text: What a nice little surprise. A bit of a strange atmosphere, but fun. I knocked a star off because it smells like stale cigarettes and is a bit outdated. We've had lunch here several times, great!  First night we tried to come there was some sort of "Death Metal" band playing and there was a huge crowd, on night 2 was Christmas Karaoke. Food is Excellent, super service every time we go there. Great Pandora channel playing during lunch. We'll see you again tomorrow.

oLWqYR8lNS5DKDXw_t8lDA.text: Worse customer service. I called to order my food the guy said can you please hold. 15 minutes still on hold. At at the place and the guy goes I forgot is not even busy. They didn't even offer a ice pop while I wait. This has the worse service ever.

SObAhW-WLKU0xIzzTtbJ9g.text: Went to this place for the first time last night. The food was freaking OUTSTANDING.  Came here to write a review and was completely baffled by some of the other extremely poor reviews...  I will say that I know that this restaurant just recently moved from another location, and I have to wonder if the chaos that that sort of event can create in a business was responsible for some of the other reviewers' poor experiences?  The decor is a bit strange, I will give it that. It's a bit pool hall, a bit dive bar, a bit karaoke bar... Not really a place that, just LOOKING at it, you would think would have great food.  I went in with a friend (fellow foodie) who'd been and was a fan. We grabbed seats at the bar and were immediately served by Victor, the owner.  Victor is funny and personable, and clearly has a quirky personality. After meeting and speaking with him, I think the atmosphere is really just a reflection of who he is. He is quick to laugh, loves karaoke, and is passionate about creating quality food (we had a 5 minute discussion about his selection of high-quality rice, preparation methods for it, etc.).  MY experience was probably the tastiest Vietnamese food I have ever had. I will definitely be a repeat customer and can't wait to try more of the menu.  Last night I had the Spicy Spring Rolls (BBQ pork, rice paper wrapper, Sriracha & Peanut sauce), Tom Chien Gion (Fire-Cracker Shrimp - coconut-crusted, deep fried shrimp with sweet & sour sauce), and Com Bo Luc Lac (Shaken Beef). Everything was perfection. And the beef was juicy, tender and flavorful.  Service was impeccable...  If you love good food, and a venue with a personality, do NOT skip this place due to a few bad reviews. If you're worried, find Victor. He will be sure to take care of you.

pbz7SwdxQYTEQOVkTR5vmQ.text: So many overpriced douchey places are popping up in our valley. Pho Cao is not one of them!   This is the real deal. Great food served late for a steal. This is the type of place that has launched AZ musicians. See the next Gonna Blossoms/ RCP before they hit it big. Not a strip mall joint, not some corporate crap; a small stage with great sound!  Delicious 8-15 buck plates and full bar too. Oh yeah, lots of parking too.

ODiZRk6MbUvwuOpcS0WeNg.text: Amazing pho!! Friendly staff! The only reason I gave it one less star is because the band that was playing was soooo loud that my boyfriend and I couldn't hear each other from across the table. I also have slight hearing issues and it gave me a headache, but if their Amps had been turned down just a little bit it would have been much more enjoyable. Also was confused when we walked in because there wasn't a sign saying seat yourself or wait to be seated... a nice woman came in from outside and then told us we can have a seat wherever. Other than those two minor set backs, it was the best pho we have had!

qtFll-teroh4V2pAkB-W2A.text: The food here is really good. I feel like the environment could use a bit of a renovation but the main attraction is the bowls of Pho and they are phenomenal.   One night there were all screaming/ metal band with enough wattage to power an EDC concert it was deafening lol).  I wont ding them too hard because I am sure it was not done on purpose or maybe I didn't realize it was a metal concert that night.

hapDoNhVm23rEHOgXqV1bw.text: Up and running!  PHO CAO opened up this week in my neighborhood, I was hoping someone would take over the former Longshots and do something cool with it. Well some one did take it over and transplanted a Vietnamese Rock and Roll nightclub/restaurant.   If you go, know this they haven't finished the place yet, at least I hope not. A severe lack of attention to detail persist through out this cavernous space.  Here are several observations on this Transplant in my hood.  1 I was hoping for better 2 Clean this place up, they need to hire a girl that likes to clean. All dudes on staff. 3 lighting is horrendous I hope they take a strong look at that and make some changes  4 Do something with that bar, your liquor looks old and very disorganized, It's massively inefficient. 5 I hope the food improves my dish was just ok, I have heard great things just haven't tasted them yet. btw my order was incorrect but after we established the waiter misunderstood me and it wasn't made for someone else I insisted I keep it. 6 They need some bike racks lots of them, and light them up, Trust me on this. 7 I hope the smokers find a better place to smoke then just outside the front door. 8 This place actually needs a front door! The tiny black dirty metal door is not welcoming at all. They should drop a few bucks there for sure. in the interim put a plant, a porch light, and a rug there so customers don't have to guess how to enter. If it weren't for the smokers It would have taken more effort to find it. 9 Get a real website if they had a contact us, this would have been sent in private.  Positives 1 Live Music 2 Take out and delivery 3 Late Night Hours 4 Service was pretty good 5 This place has potential if the owners don't rest on past reputation and pay attention to details. 6 Great location on McDowell and 74th st. When the apartments are finished this place will be jumping.  I will return because I know it will be better then it was.

jVkH_kBM_pzMwQxSU4qfPw.text: I have gone here a couple of times for lunch, and I tried this place for a late dinner on a Saturday night. I think the experience is a 3 but the food is a 4.   The good: the pho and the goi cuon (spring and "summer" rolls) are pretty legit. Despite the higher prices (what do you expect in Scottsdale), the flavor is on point. The service is fast and I like that there is an option to have beer with my Vietnamese food (because Heineken makes the experience, people).  The meh: Weekend nights are strange here. We showed up at around 8 or so. There were 3-4 different cover bands singing karaoke-grade covers, and all 55+ as far as age. That's not a bad thing, it just wasn't the scene I was hoping for. It was, however, really obvious they need a sound guy. The feedback on the speakers was miserable and ongoing. Not pleasant for a dining experience.   I would like to go back again (and this is 100x better than Noodles Ranch up the street) but I'll try again on karaoke night to see how the vibe is.

GMghsMymeST3--S0Of27sQ.text: Pho cao dao from Cali will never top any pho I'll ever eat but surprisingly I enjoyed the pho from this resto. The noodles were fresh and their crispy rolls was cooked to perfection. Definitely would come back again! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

XoWAODBPoVa9ADQgfH9R0Q.text: I drove by Pho this week & couldn't wait to try it!  Came back tonight for Sunday dinner around 6pm.  There was live music and a seat yourself atmosphere.  The inside surprised me, because it's basically an old dive bar.   We searched for a booth, but they were mostly dirty.  I noticed a girl slowly attempting to clear tables. Like 1 cup at a time.  Once we sat at a booth for 8, the only option for our family of 3, she stopped cleaning the other booths.  The menu was extensive with lots of Asian cuisine, random American food of fries & wings, and of course Pho.  The food & service was pretty quick. The food was warm and tasty.   As we sat and ate, it was odd to me, as an ex-waitress, how short staffed the place seemed and how long tables stayed dirty.  I watched a waiter walk up to a dirty table next to us and clear off 1 fork. Only. Then shake his head at the rest.  Our waitress was nice, but literally ran around and shouted responses to customers, "seat your self" "Walk up to the bar"  And looked pained when I asked for an extra plate for my son.  It was the kind of service that wasn't terrible, but didn't leave room for 5 stars, because they were running around crazy.  The music, at 6pm dinner, was also kind of terrible. Filled with swearing & bad Croning.  While the food was pretty decent, the dark atmosphere, random music and hardly cleanly spaces make me think I most likely won't be back.

269cWydZuq1-RgDJJzYOGw.text: So, I was actually a virgin to Pho until I tried it here for the first time. Now I can't get enough. It's delicious, filling as well as healthy.  I was told by a worker there that they cook the broth for 24 hours. I tried the beef and the chicken, both were equally tasty. The portion is large. One soup makes two full meals for me. Very fair prices too.    The staff was very welcoming and friendly when I went, which is the main reason why I keep going back.  The restaurant does look like a dive bar for sure which I was not expecting when I walked in, but its still a nice local place to eat.    Tip- they have karaoke if your into that

XZLJ6OZavLYwV2vd8mq9Ig.text: Perhaps it's my bad for not doing some due diligence. This place is just icky.. it's a dive bar with a misleading name. Silly me, I thought I could get a decent bowl of pho in a place called "Pho Cao"...   I wish I could even say it was mediocre. Brown, cloudy, tasteless broth with a pile of sticky overdone noodles.... Do not waste your time. I walked out. The service was prompt and cheerful

YGnSmqWve9nE8HmtU3gbBA.text: The band was good. Crowd was strange. Food was ok, service not the best. Air conditioning is dirty and so is the rest of the place.

gkn3DRiyMWBkIY_oLtRVlg.text: We stopped by while we were passing though Tempe late at night. Surprise they were still open. It was a Thursday night guest it was also karaoke night. Food was really good.

tA02tm3POkXCcaxqjV2-rw.text: I have been here a dozen times but three times in the last 5 weeks. The first time my friend and i never got greeted and we waited in a booth for a good 15 minutes so we just walked out. One female bartender on and not one server in site. 3 tables and approximately 5 guests at the bar. Second time we had a male server with long curly hair serve us and was very sweet and attentive! Food was awesome! Third time, a tall male server greeted us with the phrase "are waters good?" before we even sat down. No suggestive selling or basic welcome in intro, felt awkward and not personal. Never got refills or offered refills until we were completely finished. This place always feels under staffed and besides the one time, we consistently get spotty, subpar service . Sometimes they have a bartender sometimes it's one doing everything. Awesome food consistently! Always fresh and hot. Someone just needs to give the servers some training or hire people who are better at their jobs.

yYlUxGkO3dkY221u_7evIg.text: I've been coming here for several years now (since its previous location on Scottadale road), and find the pho quality acceptable for the most part, and love the atmosphere and service.  So maybe 3 stars for pho itself and 4 stars for the service/atmosphere?  Problem is that I find the combination of the two features (pho and live music) a little dissonant.  Traditionally, pho is a breakfast meal and the broth can take all night to cook, eaten during a sliver of peaceful time you can find in the day.  Pho served here is indeed that-- big broth bowls for roughly $8/$11 for regular/large bowls. Quality is a little lower than other pho but is otherwise as traditional as any pho place you'd find in the US. The type of music/karaoke that's done at Pho Cao, on the other hand, is the opposite of that (despite some good acoustic musicians here!).  I think it's awesome that the venue is trying to trendset the two, but honestly the pho quality doesn't support it.  The servers seem to work pretty hard but it's just not the same pho quality because of the interference with bar/drink duties on top of food. If at all, I'd be willing to pay more for higher quality pho (and served differently than a traditional large bowl style) as that would jive better.

LqNkb3MpQwi2LaOwv2ShWw.text: Best pho in Phoenix, (definitely the best broth) with ample toppings.  I am usually disappointed by pho from other places because I often compare it to Pho Cao.  The inside is a little bit divey and sometimes the live music is a little bit loud.

6qigQaGAk3q3Sql8ztIaDA.text: If you're looking for Pho and live music, this is the spot for you! I came in on a Wednesday night because it was the only Pho place open and I was sure in for a surprise. They had live rock night. The vibe is totally dive-y. I don't know how well Pho and dive bars mix, but they did it right here. The Pho was really flavorful and served with all of the add-ins (jalapeno, cilantro, sprouts, etc.). I want to come here for dinner and drinks before a night out on a Friday. I feel like it would be an awesome pregame spot!!! All of their drinks had really clever names as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KkQVh_z4A0_4C0gkRhKrbw.text: Prices are high for pho but if you eat during happy hour, with bogo 1/2 off app and $1 off pho bowls, it's a bit more reasonable.  Our waitress didn't give us the discount till we asked for it.  I had the Pho Cao special bowl P1.  Broth was okay but didn't taste like it had been simmering all day.  The noddles were slightly over cooked.  We also had the soft spring rolls and the spicy wings.  The wings were not crispy and cook just poured buffalo sauce over wings on plate creating a soup rather than tossing them playing.  Spring rolls were delicious.   Service was fine.  Other than male wait staff placing our orders on edge of table then walking away without eye contact, and female server not providing discount before being asked, Service was prompt and courteous.  I would come back when in mood for pho.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EX-UeLi1new8bV39klkDhw.text: Excellent food and service!  Friendly staff and Pho was full of flavor. Great vegetarian options too!

Jq2GNz2Qn3MoybOCeTQxxQ.text: Be careful of what you order because everything is cooked in the same wok.   I'm actually really disappointed. I read so many good reviews about this place that the food was phenomenal. But when we showed up and inform the waitress that my date has a terrible allergy to shrimp and asked if there was anyway to have her meal prepared in a way that there was no cross contamination. We were informed that wasn't possible.  We asked about the vegan broth, but were informed that everything goes all in the same wok so cross contamination was going to happen.   You even advertised that if you had a food allergy to let the wait staff know and they will accommodate your needs. This didn't happen and we had no other option but to leave and go some place else.   Frankly I'm just straight up perplexed and disgusted at the casual disregard for people with any type of food allergy.

jtTZ-iX2qBn1uWL_ewNQxA.text: This place is great. Good service, some of the best Pho in town, and the live music gives it a great touch. Pho Cao is definitely a south Scottsdale staple at this point. Check it out!

7T9MDbvQ11SDvkewaNr7FQ.text: Wow! This place suck at customer service! What a confusing process of how they run their operations. 1. You sit down 2. Five people ask you what you want to eat and drink 3. 20 mins later without a drink of food. 4 all 5 were confused who took the order or menu. 6. Food served from the angry cook/owner! Wow.

KGvfIjW7wlL8onnn9QxZPQ.text: They have GLUTEN FREE SOY SAUCE avaiable!! So the rest of us can have Vietnamese dishes the way they were intended!

G6UXHGbobkcqMUSe_o7MDw.text: They have a great lunch special of potstickers or eggrolls + large bowl of pho for like $10 or whatever but the actual pho was really underwhelming. The broth just was very bland and they served it with a fork--not very authentic. I can see how the south west isn't known for thriving pho/asian cuisine.

pLFkV-KUsnSex-Yp6g-v_Q.text: This is one of my favorite pho places in Phoenix! Definitely my go to spot. It's very authentic and decently priced. It's great how they have options in different sizes for your pho bowls! I definitely recommend trying out their spicy broth, it's delicious. Atmosphere is awesome! At night time, it can be a bit busy with their karaoke nights and shows but it's the best to walk into! Sometimes it's hard to call ahead to order take out, but most of the time it's due to the shows and it can get loud in there. Staff is extremely nice and very accommodating!

-lXAQ5gJYmFCP2ey1skuXg.text: Place to come for Pho and live music. The servers are very friendly. Please is clean and prices

wncvvHhvTBwXlNrAmVIhKQ.text: This is a new location for Pho Cao since they moved.  I rather liked this location better than the first since it's easier to access and the layout is more open.  Open mic on Sunday evenings!    I sat at the bar alone and at first Pho Cao somewhat still confuses me; Vietnamese Pho restaurant at a dive bar?  I guess it works in a sense, but I was just trying to watch the game and didn't care much for the performance.  I ordered a Export 33 to start and just a bowl of regular Pho.  They have ramen Pho, but I wasn't sure if I should go for it since I didn't feel to adventurous that night.  Overall, the Pho is pretty good.  Broth came nice and piping hot they way I like it!  I think the side sprouts, basil, and jalapeno could be at tad bit fresher, but maybe it's out of season.    In the end, Pho Cao definitely caters to a new crowd that enjoys their Pho with a beer and live music.  You probably won't see many traditional Pho lovers here, but that doesn't matter.  I would like to point out I do appreciate good service here.  My bartender was busting her butt; as a former waiter, I totally understand that work life and appreciate what it has made me become.  Kudos to the bartender! - Enjoy!

UE3QzjybIPiVd7eZx60hWw.text: I've ordered number one with rice noodle today and when I got home and opened it they used a ramen noodle. The one u buy in the store for 25 cent very dissapointed. One star for ontime delivery.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ramen soup dissapointed....

XYwBohxnvRUQOp-Ap_DHHg.text: Not authentic Vietnamese food.  The taste and the food is more for American people.  And they are pricey too.  Pho didn't tastes very exciting but the fish sauce chicken wings were good.  They were a little spicy but we could handle it.

beg8Y-Y84HD7sdzLKHeK3w.text: Husband and I went here for the first time tonight......  we are new to this area of Scottsdale and always like to try out the nearby businesses wherever we live... especially love to support family run businesses opposed to big franchise whenever we can. We don't know a lot about Vietnamese cuisine but have eaten it before at a couple other places over the years, including a food truck operation that offered up pho and other vietnamese foods; my husband had the pho with chicken and they bring you the broth and the add ins separately so you can add what you want ....since they do include Jalapenos, nice to be able to add what you prefer to spice it to your liking; I had the pineapple rice with chicken and shrimp which was served in a half of a pineapple, was wonderful and attractively presented.  Portions are very ample, hubby did devour every drop of his soup and I brought enough leftovers home for both of us tomorrow  :) While eating we enjoyed some awesome blues.... I understand this band is there regularly..... great service, the staff was wonderful, it's a fun place to people watch and we look forward to coming back often....

kskBR9cPz8fFcaWlUS-wlQ.text: Biggest rip off ever. Boyfriend went in to pick up for us. We got the salmon spring rolls. They totally sucked. And claimed to have all these ingredients and all it came with was lettuce and salmon. No avocado, nothing. My pho was fine. But online it was supposed to be 9.50 with all my add ins and it came out to 17.50. Complete ripoff. And my boyfriend got an entree with steak and shrimp. Tiny portion of steak and three tiny shrimp. 12 dollars. Sooooo ridiculous. Never going back. Otherwise the restaurant itself looks cool inside but would not recommend eating there if you want to get what you pay for BC you pay a lot and get nothing.

OtqCkk-YF4w9uGTxk9NCmA.text: GREAT PHO!!!! friendly staff easy parking

3_AW8xhyw0DVRb8MNkg3JA.text: I've been a regular for the past 3 years. I came in to new location order lollipop Wings only to be disappointed they came and we're regular typical wings nothing special and definitely not lollipop wings? Came back a couple weeks later normally they have the very best broth for Pho very rich and full of flavor. Again I was disappointed it tasted like tap water that was over chlorinated. Never have I had a problem with the Pho before. Hopefully they pull it together and get consistent as far as food quality and service.

OqZfWBYhYH9tI2IUOWloKg.text: I ordered takeout for the seafood dish. I wasn't that impressed with the crispy noodles, but the quality of the seafood was high. And the steamed veggies that are included with the dish were very flavorable. It's expensive but worth the additional expense if you're looking for high quality vietnamese food.

XJaHBGPGPMExfPiZKcobZg.text: I ordered takeout for my husband and I for dinner.  I really liked the vibe, I felt like I was in a neighborhood bar restaurant back in ny. Very refreshing to not be in your typical Scottsdale franchise.  I ordered at the bar, the bartender was friendly and very helpful. As I waited for my food I observed a mixed crowd. Family with a baby, college students ,older women chatting with me at the bar, while the band was warming up. It was very clean and comfortable. I ordered Salmon Spring Rolls  which was the only food item I didn't care for ,everything else was really good. I also had the pineapple fried rice which was served in  a pineapple! We also had the endamame Sauteed in garlic, chili and I think lemongrass . We also got spring rolls that were soo good and my husband got some fried rice dish with meat and he loved it! I'm so excited to have a great ethnic restaurant / bar in my neighborhood,  finally!

RIk71n97b4YDVouv7wgNZQ.text: They have the BEST PHO. Little dive bar love it. They have live music I was there for lunch. Our server was fantastic too.

vfVfECsyMKoWX0NSudvwZw.text: Ive tried this place twice now, and Ive yet to be terribly impressed. I absolutely love quality PHO and both trips to Pho Cao have made me wish I had went to my usual spot on the west side. I live in Old Town so this spot is convenient, but not much more than that. Service is ALWAYS slow, and forgetful. I have visited the old spot by the freeway, and now the new spot off of McDowell and both places were dark, dank and dive-y. I can appreciate a good dive bar, and even hole-in-the-wall type places, but this place seems to miss the mark on both. The Pho broth tastes like ramen broth. It isnt clear like good, slow simmered pho both is supposed to be. Pho Cao's broth is brown and the noodles are always clumped together in a ball at the bottom of the bowl. The spring rolls are decent but the peanut sauce is def from a jar. Its overtly sweet and tastes more like a peanut butter paste than sauce. Like I said, its not horrible, its just not a genuine pho restaurant. This is a karaoke joint that services hipsters who want to think they are eating genuine pho. Service is slow, and food is mediocre. I doubt I will return.

DYLe1KvrdJ9gyLvv-YriMg.text: Bland Bland Bland the food was awful and the server never asked how everything was because she already knows the answer it is awful. Do not waste your money! Talk about a surprise when you walk in to a nightclub like bar.

r3RVNs-pdSn_pqDpWIhSIA.text: The pho was amazing and the pork spring rolls are out of this world (so is the peanut sauce for them!). The pho broth was light and silky yet exploding with flavor. Excellent place for lunch.

Kovmo2zZ9Z0frzrzxwvJDA.text: Food was good as usual. I have been here many times and will be back. Salmon rolls were great and so was the fried rice with shrimp, bbq pork, and Chinese sausage, except there was only three shrimp, overcooked, with the tail on. I really don't enjoy having to dig into my dish to remove the tails and they were hard to cut with a fork being over done. My friend had shrimp fried rice with more shrimp in it and spent the first five minutes of his meal doing the work the kitchen should've done to be able to enjoy his meal. Also no knives served with it to cut them. But that's not why I only gave it three stars, but it was our server too. We usually get great service from two particular servers who I will not name, but this time we got someone else. He failed to offer us drinks, which we did want an alcoholic drink before the meal waiting for for our appitizers, but we were only offered water. On top of that our food came out in two dramatic shifts instead of being timed better, although that could be the server, the two dishes were the fried rice which hold well and he could have made the delivery better. I had to get my own napkins from the bar and take a condiment tray from another table because he failed to bring one or to do the two bite/two minute check on our table. No, it wasn't busy, it was karaoke night and later in the evening so most people weren't eating. One friend had to stop him to order his drink but it had to be refilled but had to stop another server for a refill. Will be back, he will not be our server.

_Js3aLN6--uLOwaxmAWVrw.text: My Steak and brisket pho had about 6-8 pieces of 1.5"x3" paper thin pieces of meat.  It tasted awful without adding soy sauce and chile pepper sauce.  Lots of rice noodles though.  The peas were few, and were dry and sriveled as though they'd been freezer burned and thrown into the hot broth frozen.  So essentially, I paid 7.40 for 40oz of liquid with rice noodles that had been associated with some beef.  And the liquid was foul tasting.  The spring rolls were perfect.  They were obviously made in a factory and shipped frozen then deep fried at the restaurant.  We went on Sunday Night- open mic night.  There were lots of musicians, and two of them were talented.  Had we not already ordered an appetizer we would've left without eating.  Then we missed our second chance when the wait person (very nice, but unbelievably forgetful) forgot our order.  When they (I am trying to keep the person anonymous) returned to be reminded of the entrees we wanted, they had someone else's credit card, and had forgotten to return it to him.  We both ordered pho.  It's feaux pho, if you ask me.  Behind us sat a group of young men who lacked the vocabulary, self-control and courtesy to refrain from dropping an F-bomb in every sentence.  My wife and I suffered through our awful meal with this profinty laden cacophany of lousy music and loud drunken talking.  There are lots of great Asian options nearby, this one is very cheap.  But for a little more you can get some hearty and delicious Vietnamese food.  If you like this place, go to Miss Saigon in Tucson next time you're down that way.  But be warned: If you do, you'll never want to return to Pho Cao.  Or go to Totties, which is at the SW corner of Hayden and Thomas (about 2 miles from this joint).  Both have more authentic (and far more enjoyable) food, Totties has the nicer atmosphere.  I'm sure I could name quite a few others.

r_Ucpi0UXdZFzq1smi4D_Q.text: Worst experience ever hair in the rice, cold tea, cold food, diarrhea for the day, waitress argued the fact that the tea water was mad by the morning crew...it was 7:30 pm. Spoke with the manager Victor for an adjustment, was told if I removed my review. U take the chance if u dare!

AFBfAmM4bMm5S9H186_n5w.text: Great twist to a Pho setting! Loved it. Friendly, down to earth staff. Great food. Prompt service. Plenty of TV's if you're trying to catch a game. Music, on point!

THEfz1kvuOG7pgctFvzP-w.text: Pho Cao just moved to our neighborhood so we decided to check it out and we're glad we did. We tried the fried tofu and the spicy mayo served with it was ok but we asked our server to bring peanut sauce and that was awesome. The dumplings had a delicious filling and great sauce as well. There was also hoison sauce, soy and sriracha on the table. I love sauces so I was in heaven! Jessica was our server and she was super nice, attentive and helpful with the menu. I got the chicken and veggies on egg noodles but....I added chinese sausage, which is my favorite!  It was really flavorful and there were a lot of veggies including bok choy, cabbage, onion, carrot etc...my main complaint was the music. Although it was jazz and not a bad band at all, it was just too loud.

J2KyrXapASpDpmNpjQsmYQ.text: Everything was surprisingly good I don't like pho but I was pleasantly surprised when I had theirs they also have really good spring rolls I will return servers were excellent and very kind and help me decide what to order

H_mRmMw9d9R9LGd9vYAmNw.text: This is my new go to Pho restaurant. The food is great I usually get the Pho w/ meatballs and rare steak and the crispy egg rolls. I love karaoke so I usually come when they have it on Thursday nights. The kj Phil is really good. The bartender Shaun and owner Victor are really fun too. I went last night and about to go again tonight :) it really has a nice neighborhood bar feel.

hvBXJah7YTB3nulkbtlOtQ.text: Don't order the food... We went to watch a show here and I got really bad food poisoning from it. A couple family friends said the exact same thing. Drinks were okay, and the place looks very nice, so it's a shame that the food wasn't good and may have been handled improperly

tMf9JYxvmSeCLLXY2QeSnw.text: Went here for lunch during the work week. My friend and I split an order of spring rolls - delicious, and then I ordered the pho tai - DELICIOUS! I'm a total pho snob and this pho was yummy. They were also very quick to bring our food out. Beware, this isn't a normal Vietnamese restaurant you think of when going to get pho, it is more of a bar atmosphere and was pretty dark inside - that would probably be my only negative thing to say about it, however that could be a very positive thing for someone else and I'm sure it makes for great ambiance if going at night or on the weekend.

u1Y0yxvf80SxfmOCOwBANQ.text: This place was a dissapointment. It smells inside, but my fiance and I decided to give it a chance since it was highly recommended. My fiance ordered pho and I ordered the yellow curry. The beer was flat and the broth in my dish was watered down. It wasnt worth the money we spent and we would not go there again.

VWmokzS2EJ66mYbZMl_cOQ.text: I love this place! It's kind of different they have entertainment, it's kind of dark inside but the food is outstanding, prices are good and staff is great! In fact I'm going again tonight. I checked groupon but unfortunately found none. Please get hooked up with groupon. See you tonight!

QyoLAQM9-lBNvmgM0JN49g.text: This place is awesome!  Food is always on point, atmosphere is classic, and the owner is super friendly. He is always there to greet you and make sure your well taken care of! Highly recommend!!!

NtiY7rfkk2cjCg8UPjZ_6g.text: This place is amazing! Super delicious and fantastic price for the amount of food you get! We recommend this to everyone!

Lg2exPYEsjJG7JkUiNxsCA.text: It's ok. New place still trying to figure it out. First time we came here I ordered the fried rice. It was horrible. Came out cold and greasy. Second time I ordered the Steak Pho. It just left this weird taste in my mouth but was good. Music was way too loud though. It seems popular though on certain nights. Parking lot is packed. I'll probably come back but not sure about it yet.

uyyONHTzUKGzBUmeBrXzCA.text: Pho was super tasty and so was the spring roll.  Tried the salmon spring roll and the salmon was way overdone.  Otherwise was great and Chris our server was very good too.  Will be back!!

bnRsqE-hU-ovsECX5tIn8w.text: Moving from the Pho and Starbucks capital of the country to Scottsdale has been tough.( for PHO ) Since Scottsdale thinks Pho Ga is just bland, watery chicken soup they can charge a fortune for, I've been driving to Chandler for the good stuff. THEN this place opened. Yelp reviews have kept me away until today. It's a dark bar atmosphere, Not dirty at all. My server was great. Live music at lunchtime on Sunday was also fun. Now, the pho. Someone complained that the broth was brown not clear.....yea,  well so? It was full of flavor. Clump of noodles in the center, again, yea so ??? they were perfect and lots of them. Happy girl !!! wonderful, thank you for being here. I'll be back often. Run, don't walk to check this place out, unless you like bowls of water elsewhere, that is.

p2rzQ4xJyplB2xrfJ3vQKg.text: I really want to love this place, but I have had much better Pho elsewhere. Staff wasn't fully trained. I specifically asked for NO tripe, yet it was included in my dish. This location has potential, but needs to work out the kinks before I return.

XZUJkGocKo7VHAt79V-PvA.text: I was a little hesitant to come after my friend got food poisoning from here but saw this was the only place with vegetarian pho + broth. I was initially thrown off when walking in because it doesn't look like a typical Vietnamese restaurant. It's actually a bar that sells Vietnamese food. The server was really nice and the food was decent. And the spring rolls were on the smaller side but still tasty.

leSF-a_lJ09mOHnFSxtaqA.text: What a disaster.  I go in with my girlfriend, we sit, the place is almost empty. I use the men's room, it smells like the sewer line is open.  Come back, we order a beer and a white wine.  Waitress comes back with a room temperature glass of wine, I get a bottle, no glass to pour it in.  Waitress disappears, I go up to bar to get a glass, and the guy at the bar does a 90 degree turn away from me.  Eventually he comes back, I ask for a glass, and my dining partner asks for white wine that isn't warm.  OK, food time.  We both order Pho Ga', chicken pho.  My chicken is half cooked, and the pieces are all ligaments and muscle.  Waitress gives us our food, says she will be right back with napkins, but never comes.  After several minutes she comes by to ask how we are doing, I say "uh, napkins", and she runs to get them, drops them off on the table and blithely says "no problem!".  Well, there is a problem, when she comes back again, I show her undercooked chicken with all kinds of gristle and un-chewable bits on it.  She apologizes and offers to get me something else...well, if you can't cook chicken, then I don't want anything else.  I ask for the check and get another snotty "no problem!" response.  Well, there is a problem, bad food, bad service, dangerously under cooked chicken and a bathroom that smells like death.  No, I'm not going back, there are plenty of quality Pho restaurants out there that offer quality food and good service.  This place is a disaster.  Edited to add 5/26/16:  After posting this review, the manager, David Gump sent me a profanity laced email (he used the F word 4 times) and accused me of being cheap and trying to get a free meal...I NEVER asked for anything to be comped.  He also said that I was banned for life and that "We have wars because of people like you.  You need to get back to school and get educated."  I'd post more of his email, but I do not wish to share the profanities that he sent to me.  His email to me really confirms that this is not a place I ever want to do business with again.  Please avoid this place and this unprofessional manager.

8P6Suu802jMR2fwoV7zwsg.text: I REALLY REALLY wanted to love this place. Two stars is being kind. The location has been empty for year and as a Pho aficionado, I was so supper excited to see this place opening in my neighborhood. I do understand that during my visit, they were still trying to work out some kinks, which is always to be expected of new restaurants. However, it was way unorganized. When I walked in you immediately see a large bar right in front of you (which is where all the employees seemed to be). There was no hostess in the hostess area, so I just went to the bar. I wanted to order food to go and let a server know this. I sat for 20 min before even getting a menu, waited another 10 min for someone to take my order, and another 20 min for my actual food. Meanwhile I sat at the bar while an employees complained loudly amongst themselves about all the work they had to do that day. I stayed because I hoped the food would make up for it all. The answer is, it did not. I  ordered House Pho, dumplings, egg rolls, and fried rice. All the non soup items were very greasy and lacked seasoning. The pho too was under seasoned and my noodles were gummy.  I might give this place another shot an a few more months and a few more reviews to allow them some time to get things going.

9o54fatbRmGgGkJWFZhEgw.text: This place was horrible! Environment inside = wayyyyyy too dark! Went about 11am, going from the bright outside to super dark inside it took like 5 minutes for my eyes to full adjust to be able to see anything! Ordered our food... 2 spring roll appetizers and 2 bowls of pho, papaya salad, and lemongrass chicken. In a normal Vietnamese restaurant your spring roll is out in about 5-10min max from ordering... Then your pho follows shortly after.... Not this place!! 20min later ONE spring roll, the nem nuong came out.... Highly disappointed.... Would not have known it was nem nuong if I didn't order it.... Another 25min later our pho comes out along with the other 2 dishes .... Pho was bland and flavorless.  It should NOT take 40-45min to get pho ..... When there was only 3 other tables in the restaurant..... PLUS  we didn't even get the other spring roll we ordered!!! Completely disappointed.... Went to the location when it used to be next to the 202.... Figured we'd tried it one more time.... Will never go back.. There are much better Vietnamese restaurant around.

2BptB_0ycX8DQMVFU94v7Q.text: Loved it! First time here and it was great! Great food, great atmosphere and Michael was awesome! Will be back for sure!

fGlxTWgZ4SNSIMpSnLnIXg.text: Do not order takeout unless you want to wait an extraordinarily long time for your food. I ordered a meal for 2 that normally would take 30 minutes to prepare. Arrived in time only to sit st the bar for an additional 30 minutes. I honestly believe that the food had not even been started until I arrived. I asked how long it would take and the bartender/ waitress told me she didn't know she that she told the owner. Ok?? Told the owner what exactly? I never found out. In her defense it seemed as if she was doing everything in her power to try and run the whole restaurant. In closing the place is a complete shitshow and completely disorganized. I blame the owners and management. It is completely evident that they do not value their carryout customers. If I owned a restaurant and people were kept waiting I would most certainly apologize, introduce myself and rectify the situation to their liking. The woman before me waiting for carryout also told me she was waiting forever. She did not seem happy. The food was surprisingly decent despite the fact it looks like the whole restaurant hasn't been properly cleaned in years. I would be scared to see what the kitchen looked like. I would not recommend this establishment. Stick to making drinks and karaoke. Would not recommend and highly doubt I will go here again.

nIcL0ubj2uZh-OzLZ8NANw.text: What a delightful surprise!  Honestly, if you're just driving by, at best, it looks like a small dive bar but treasures await inside for Foodies! We ordered takeout and ordered a drink while waiting.  If you're searching for epic cocktails - forget it.  The wine is poured out of those little airport bottles (for freshness? ) but unlike the airlines it was only $4. That said, the locals, the service (Lucas was the perfect host, bartender, and server), and the food was awesome.  While we pondered the menu an enormous plated ice cream extravaganza was delivered to the couple next to us and it could've easily been served at a fine dining restaurant.   Once home, the Shaken Beef was divine with tender, abundant filet mignon/veggies in the most delicious sauce.  It honestly is the best pepper steak I've ever had.  My friend thoroughly enjoyed the Buddha Spring Rolls.  Even the chicken fried rice stood out with large chunks of perfectly cooked chicken and good flavor. There is easy parking, karaoke, cheap drinks, and again - Incredible food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Cdb2nVg_-vYqgmIcxGOsvA.text: The food was great! And so was the waiter, but I wasn't a fan of the atmosphere at all. It's kind of dark and grungy inside. It looks like maybe a dive bar or karaoke bar at night, but it was mid day so that vibe wasn't what we were looking for and the music was so loud we could hardly talk. Food wise, everything tasted great! The prices were nice too. I'm sure if we came here in the evening to drink my review would have a different feel. In summery, if you are nearby and just want some simple and delicious pho, this is your place. Or if you order to go, you'll be happy. But maybe don't go out of your way to come here if you are looking for a cute atmosphere. P.S. there's outdoor seating (we would have done this if it wasn't so cold that day...) and plenty of parking.

JDkXjHDMAQdE3lNZQtHvHw.text: The food was pretty damn good, the music wasn't overly loud or obnoxious, decent service too.  Would come back here

IAKUJT_C_d0bF6OCmYFs5g.text: Brother brought me over here and it's pretty good I like it. Spring rolls is bomb. I love the peanut sauce that comes with it. Tonight they had karaoke. It's pretty funny the people who come to sing it's usually the drinks hahaha. But overall it's good.

LvZ8G4aG6bhUcZdDaAL-Sg.text: Solid pho broth here, great service, full bar, usually not too crowded if you don't get there too late. The egg rolls, fish balls, and wings are all solid appetizers too! Can be a little loud even without the karaoke going on.

YROZDrQAEjUM3KDlTy9ANw.text: I was having an oil change nearby so I checked the reviews of this place and decided to give it a try.  I will say that the place has a bad odor when you walk in.  Kind of smells like a stinky old bar.  Certainly not very appetizing.   I ordered the ramen noodle pho to try something different.  The pho comes with rare steak and brisket, ramen noodles, and a boiled egg.  The broth was pretty nice and the meat was fairly decent.  However, the cilantro and basil on the side looked as if it came out of the trash or the alley behind the restaurant.  Very poor quality, dry and wilted.  I would have liked to have tried the fresh spring rolls, but they were a little pricey.  They were double what I am used to paying at other Vietnamese places in the area.  Finally, there was a charge to use my credit card, which was not posted anywhere.  I had cash, but by the time I checked my receipt, it was too late to change it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sad, wilted greens on the side...

nVgvDlfanqozYQ9TxsESlA.text: I've driven by Pho Cao a bunch of times, and finally got to try it when we decided to get carry-out. I ordered the Surf and Turf pho, my s/o got the shaken beef, and my brother got the house fried rice. The pho was nothing special, though I did think it was cool that they gave me raw beef in a separate container from my soup (so it still cooked in my bowl at home). My s/o loved the shaken beef, and I also thought it was quite tasty. The house fried rice, on the other hand, was dry and the BBQ pork wasn't quite as fragrant as it usually is, so it was kind of a letdown.    Obviously, take-out isn't the best way of judging a restaurant's food quality, so keep that in mind. We weren't in there for very long, but we really dug the vibes and definitely want to go back to hang out and give the food a second chance.

c__6AjQqYHr7EQhA-3KbcA.text: Went to the open mic on Tuesday night and I can not in good conscience recommend this place to anyone. The pho was basically toilet water with some noodles and frozen vegetables and the chicken teriyaki was a step below fancy feast. The "band" consisted of a few guys yelling swear words and asking for tips while 4 saxophone players (literally 4 at once) touched tips. If that sounds like your scene, check it out.

uveO6pk9_qzC5Cg_3gMa7w.text: Such an interesting pho place! We walked in and the first thing you see is a bar. We turned to our left and there was a live band playing on a stage with people dancing. We came late at night and there weren't too many people. We had just come from an outside event and it was so cold that night, so a nice hot bowl of pho was just the thing we needed!
