mllFNGV48CtL9xnTXaX_mA.text: Most likely the best pho in all of Scottsdale, maybe the valley! Love the surf & turf pho. Get it with vegetable broth.

IozepysMCefcxP1BB5E8Lg.text: Fabulous time at Gypsy's Blues Jam every Tuesday night....   the food is much better than at any other "jam location"..... there's no comparison..... as far as the service.... the main waitress has my food and drinks ready for me without my even asking.  HOOTER, Gypsy, and many other of the musicians have become close friends of mine.     Try the Orange Chicken!!

sRcXmPDJ8V_CY0Kkga9nzA.text: Came here at 1 am to satisfy my pho craving! Reason why I like this place: 1) they open until 2am and serves pho during late hours while other pho places close at 8pm! 2) The large pho serving size was Humongous! 3) price was very reasonable! Definitely come here if you are craving pho late at night!

ilAJCMDx1AGcy1RpGak4Cg.text: Needed some spicy noodles at 9:30pm desperately! (I may or may not have been suffering from a rare lasting wine-induced craving 24 hours later. Hey, it happens. I guess.) thankfully Pho Cao was open! Never had it before. Life saver. So Postmates brought this wonderful large vegetarian pho with egg and tofu and veggies and I asked for spicy and was so good. Definitely hit the spot! Try it. I'm hungry again. Bye!

zAwxWOVVaxD_tT0cy_yxeg.text: I went here for a lunch on a Saturday. It's a pretty casual, "seat yourself, we'll be with you in a minute" place. The service was spotty - but I'm not sure if it's because they hit a rush or what. The food was okay, not the best pho I had, but decent. It's definitely geared more towards Americans, so it's not as authentic as it can be.

CjHJQSUKRGbe9hXAhd50kQ.text: LOVE Pho Cao! I have tried to go to other places for Pho, but I always end up coming back here. Their tamarind broth is bomb! And their food portion is amazing for the price. I like going on Friday evenings because they usually have random bands playing, so the different styles of music I've heard here is refreshing. The servers are fast and friendly. I always feel comfortable coming here. This place is Pho sure worth the visit!

_JdqzIOnsijegDhVo8GJ9w.text: Just tried this place out today. Not a very pleasurable experience for me. The pho was just not nearly where it should be. The broth had a gross smell to it and lacked flavor. Normally I drink the entire bowl of broth when I eat pho but I didn't wanna take more than a few sips with this one. The chicken was very rubbery too and really grossed me out. I also ordered a basket of sweet potato fries that came out hard and dark colored -nearly burnt. It just didn't satisfy me whatsoever. The decor inside is very confusing too- a vietnamese restaurant meets and american dive bar? Just didn't really make a whole lot of sense to me. The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is my server, the man with the beard, was kind and attentive. Would not recommend if you are looking for quality pho!!

gpp00joutYlhhWQtyPOvCw.text: Although the food and atmosphere was good, the service was poor. I normally do not rant about poor service because you never know if it was just a bad day but seeing other comments I see it's a reoccurring issue. Would probably come back if it was around but wouldn't go out of my way to come back

Z7JoeTYzXwjCUYDjskZLPA.text: So when you pull up you might notice that there is no windows, the parking lot looks sketchy and inside is a mix between a dive bar and a stage...  just keep swimming!!! Because at the end of all this is amazing Pho at a great price...  save room for desert they serve a coconut with the meat still on the inside (actual coconut!!) filled with ice cream and Sunday type desert...  if it is open mic night no way of knowing what you will get but even a bad voice doesn't ruin how good the food is

fz6hCQwDC68hIsmr1GeR-w.text: Love this place! My favorite spot for pho with the best service. The staff is chill and super nice

jArFl1E-vTzeDoDzZ8TaLg.text: My favorite pho sho. Awesome atmosphere, cheap drinks, all my favorite local bands... Just a great place.

8axY05csiTSVPMJSrEgigg.text: This place is very confused. It is a Vietnamese restaurant in a dirty dive bar setting, with a pool table and several flat screen TVs, and 60s music blasting in the background. My water was served in a faded Rebel IPA glass. The lighting was very odd and the place felt dark and sticky. There is also no way of looking into the restaurant from the outside, because the windows are covered and the doors have no windows.  Upon entering, a female server approached me and asked "what's up?"; when I told her I was dining in, she told me to sit anywhere. The male server I had appeared to be high and his speech was slurred and difficult to understand. There were only four other tables seated, but yet the two servers were literally running around the restaurant.  I ordered a pork chop combo (pork chop, rice, egg roll, fried egg, and chicken wings). The rice was wet and mushy and tasted like chlorine. The filling inside the egg roll tasted spoiled. Everything else was greasy and tasteless. I couldn't finish any part of my meal.  I ended up leaving and going to another restaurant down the block.

0_LOsHGs8-pOfLErOLiA4g.text: the set up is nice, but the food is awful.  I had chicken teriyaki and asked for noodles instead of white rice.  the chicken was slimy and it did not look or taste like chicken and the noodles were stuck together when I put my fork in them the whole bunch came up.  When I told them it was awful they still wanted to charge me full price.  They only gave me a 10% discount.  That's poor business I won't recommend or every eat there again.

1pJSqU-urp2lZ8OF-4XOmg.text: I am was excited to see a Pho place opening so close to my job, but this was one of the most disappointing experiences I've ever had! We were able to order right away, but watched 4 tables come in, get seated and served their food before we got our pho. We waited for 40 minutes before we got flavorless pho that was only very warm. The noodles in mine were undercooked yet the veggies were overlooked. One of the people that came in ordered, ate and paid in about 30 minutes, while we couldn't even get our change from out bill after being there for 2 hours! I will never come here again and tell everyone I know to avoid this place because you're going to wait 5 times longer than other guests for the most tasteless pho of your life!

4m4qh3YtYBR1L3yydNnteQ.text: Nice to have pho available late night but the music is so loud you can't even the person across from you. Food is decent it was nice to make my pho to my preferred level of spicy-ness. Pretty full bar, ample amount of seating, easy to locate and decent amount of parking. Still can't get over how loud it was though

uDKlqTH3f7LPiC1Z8iaRSA.text: Was excited to see this place open within walking distance of my apartment and decided to check it out. First thing you notice (or not notice) is the entrance. A side door, hardly marketed and hard to see. Once inside we were greeted by a server who informed us we could sit wherever we liked. We chose a booth in the corner of the raised area. There was a karaoke dj and a few large groups obviously there for the karaoke. The atmosphere was dark and stale. I ordered spring rolls and a regular steak pho. The rolls were nothing but filler and a few shreds of pork and a shrimp or two. They literally stuck to the plate. The pho came and my disappointment grew as I discovered 4 or less pieces of actual meat and far too few noodles to even out the amount of broth. Overall a disappointment. Would have rated one star but our server was prompt and friendly.

-s4YBGW97OeheBtKQLIj4w.text: Service great. Pho good. Atmosphere- weird in a good way. I'd come here again. Food came fast and exactly the way I wanted. Bartender/server fully aware of my needs and intuitive. Loved it.

q9ktSDykLqNPy3bOO82_aw.text: So I've been hearing lots about the new pho cao that opened in my neighborhood and was very excited to try it out. But I was even more excited when I found out they have VEGAN pho!!!! Yes! Since I don't eat beef, it's hard to find pho places that serve this yummy hot soup beef-less since its traditionally a beef based soup. And let me tell you this vegan broth was awesome! I ordered the seafood pho but with vegan broth and it was delicious, filled with mushrooms and carrots too! Yumm yum! A bit over- priced compared to other pho spots but worth it if you are a non-beef pho lover!

2LxhBHKYYaTewoQpg_7r0A.text: Yes, the place is a little odd, and from reading the reviews I can see where the place has a little bit of an identity crisis, but I thoroughly enjoyed my experience. Let me be clear though - I went to see a band, not for the pho, so take that into consideration as you read this review.   I got there about 30 minutes before the first band, and even though I went in through the wrong entrance (I went in through the door the bands load and unload) I got greeted and seated immediately. Service throughout the evening was just fine. I never had to wait around for anyone to show up with another drink, the guy was always around. Food was good. I've had better Vietnamese food in the valley, but have no complaints about the food served here.  I can understand someone coming specifically for Vietnamese fare and being put off by the divey sports-bar vibe at lunch time, or rolling in later at night to find a loud band up on stage, or drunk karaoke fans howling away. But for me, looking at it as a venue for live music, I think it was great. The place has a nice setup for live music and the bands sounded good. I got to sit at a table, get well taken care of by my waiter, eat decent pho, have some beers, and watch some great bands playing original music.   I'm definitely going back.

oyQcBMyoBz1wQdwpJWrDWw.text: Absolutely love this place at its new location on McDowell Road. I highly suggest to order the A2 on the menu. This is an appetizer that will work for two. It's light and healthy. They have a clean nice atmosphere that comes alive at night with live music ranging from open Mic Night to Tuesday's featuring some highly acclaimed jazz artists. Definitely check this place out!

3UVXerT7Dtok8J4LJ3Egig.text: Here's the thing... We can't stop coming here because the Pho is delicious and band that plays on Tuesday nights is so awesome! The service is about as bad as it gets... So if you're huge on getting service within 19 minutes of being sat, or your server knowing about specials, or what they have... Then skip it. But if your patient and like Pho and blues music check it out on a Tuesday!

mwRJw9eFsfeB_eFx9DpjBw.text: Nothing is good here.  Came in for lunch and was very disappointed.  No napkins on the table, no plates with our appetizer.  Paid for food we hardly touched. The flavor was off and the spring rolls were stuffed with iceberg lettuce.  The location is great but good Veitnamese food can be found elsewhere and will be worth the drive.

2qSZLzXQ8wlribKcvRibJg.text: The food is consistently good. The staff is friendly and attentive. The live music on Sunday's is entertaining. If I didn't live an hour away, I'd come more often. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the pool table, live music, and the food is always on point.

h73SUtb5BA0iesDe91Zefg.text: We love our pho.  Boyfriend had a taste for pho, we then googled the nearest places. Stopped by this place and quite surprised, live bands were playing, good sized bar, good menu choices and priced right. The spring rolls w/peanut sauce was good.  Our seafood pho was also very tasty. Was unsure about the place walking in, but all in all was good.

LxwLpYEj2aIyytLYociv1Q.text: To be honest the decor is bizarre. And the service CAN be questionable along with the live music. Not your typical Vietnamese restaurant that's for certain, but the food is always always delicious. Great pho always and very consistent. Potstickers and crispy egg roles are to die for! If you can keep an open mind and don't let the surroundings rub you the wrong way I definitely recommend.

CyAVFuIi46q2WMcMeZadxw.text: Everything I wanted with this place happened. Finally a decent dive bar in Scottsdale. Great for a few friends to enjoy decent food and drink in a great atmosphere. Food $7-$12. Drinks $2.75-$8. I love that they have live music almost every night of the week.

XZUm6A5LDT8DYP_Yw_l8Yg.text: Yay !!! Finally found a pho place that actually open till 2am!! And so I thought........this place is baaaaaddddd  !!! I order pho with steak, tripe, tendon... The broth taste terrible .. it literally taste like they open a can of chicken broth cook it and add white noodles to it!! Shoot I can make better pho than this ... And I don't know how lol  my friend order ramen noodle(something like that) he said "ramen noodle make better ramen than that" hahaha  guess he's not a fan too. On a positive note They do have live band ... On the look for another pho place

IpIoSCVtX4zXCsBuPChKQA.text: I'm so glad Pho Cao is reopened- and closer to my house! Food is as great as before, service is better than before. Couldn't be happier! Well, unless they got their website and online ordering back up and running. But still- 5 stars!

9CSs6uX5u4XJMiUIvhS1xw.text: Bate and switch from their menu online to the menu in the restaurant.  Pho was alright, server was nice but the place is a horrible dive.  Owner is a douche

eS_0DuDoebzeLMfVis62CA.text: Love the live music; no matter what music you typically listen to you can never go wrong with some live entertainment.   Vegetarian curry; warm cozy, yummy delicious plate! Highly recommend! Especially with the tofu   Vegan pho; ordered large, not too much flavor in the broth but usually this is how it is, loved the toppings, added some like and sriracha, had leftovers!   Veggie egg rolls; my favorite!!! Perfect appetizer and the sweet and sour sauce is great   Fried tofu; never tried it before so I wanted to & very glad I did, comes with spicy mayo too (not too spicy either)  Also ordered a gin & tonic, very heavy pour!   Service was fast and friendly! Will be returning!

EKmJv5ywBMIgvh7Qau-XFA.text: Our first time there and the food and service was excellent!  My only critique is that both entry doors are blank with no markings.  I recommend that you clearly mark your entry doors.

kwMvY-2QxeNLdoFUEGbM0g.text: This is my fav late night pho spot. I love that it's open late! It's definitely a funky spot in that it's like a massive dive bar, with a wide range of live music acts. The food is always awesome though! We usually share spring rolls, share pho and usually a fried rice or curry dish. The meatball pho is my fav and the pineapple fried rice is soooo good. My boyfriend and I legit fight over the leftovers the next day.   Service isn't overly friendly or super attentive but I sometimes don't mind that. It allows us to talk and enjoy the food and music without interruption. As long as our food and drinks comes out promptly, I'm good with it!

wsShHvKvdxonqumAUy9isg.text: I came in because of a recommendation by a friend, @beezybz. I ordered the Crispy Rolls and the Pho Tai. Both super good! My only thing is the noodles had been sitting so they were stuck together pretty well but overall, staff was nice and food was distributed quickly.   I came in a night they had live music so that was cool!

r_bDmHkicU5SeCr4nLM9zw.text: The food is really good here! A great spot for pho in the valley. However when I went there at regular dinner time on a Saturday night (6/7) they already had a live band playing, the music was so loud I couldn't even have a conversation with the people I went with. I recommend just getting take out if you're not trying to scream across the table at dinner.

mw7YCu4AzcOv9MDKbQp1UQ.text: This place stole from me I asked for extra shrimp and steak on surf and turf I get home to find it's barely nothing in my bag then I call back to and the manager says I'm lying about my order!! Disgusted sad will never go here again and I don't recommend it to anyone else stole my money and didn't even care smh like I have to lie about shrimp!!! Who does that a bag a shrimp is 13 dollars at store wh would I have to lie about food!!! I recommend else where very dirty environment anyway!!

XhLNH_LPvJNhTcCUWIQOag.text: I suppose I get the mixed reviews. I have never had such poor service and communication ever. I ordered online with a 45 min eta. I did show up early but waited an additional 30 min. Asked about my order 3 times without response. Another customer eventually asked about my order.... and they informed me they haven't started making it yet.... and told me it would be an additional 10-15 minutes.  Honestly, I'm willing to wait for a decent meal, but I would never in my life come back here. This is definitely my worst take out experience I've had in my life.

Ea0xns1tmJ8eFz-vOwcGlA.text: A great karaoke spot, but a mediocre restaurant experience. The happy hour deals were a crowd-pleaser, but I don't understand how they get away with charging a cover after 8.  The pho was ok, but unimpressive. I felt that way about the sweet chili wings too. Service wasn't fast, but it was accurate, and the place was pretty crowded for a Thursday.  Reviews are accurate- if you know the place is a little dive-y, you'll have a great time. I'd come back for happy hour and karaoke but I'll be exploring elsewhere for my next pho stop.

jJfGY6FQaiZkn3F4kc38yw.text: First visit at lunch, this place is so dark inside it took a few minutes till I could see. This place seems more like a bar from the 80s then a restaurant. Service was good but my Pho was nothing I would order again. The place had many patrons so I guess I ordered the wrong thing or people who like to eat in the dark come here ??? I'm curious what the place is like at night.

Hi2ctvO24T1bq30ffyWKpw.text: The 5 stars is for our first visit here.  We came to Phoenix for a wedding and I was ceaving Pho. Heard about this place and wanted to check it out because it had a bar and a live band. My wife and I order the summer rolls and a pho combo and a plain pho.  The noodles were cooked perfectly and the Pho was very good.  The summer rolls were also good.  There was a live band playing when we got in and then a half an hour later, another band played.  It was nice to see the restaurant support local artists.  I have to say, the second band was heavy metal and surprisingly pretty good!  It can get very loud so if you are here to just enjoy a meal in quiet then this place may not be for you.  Great spot and very out of the norm for a Pho restaurant but I totally dig it!

3_0zEFajEyQNiuaG3XlZ9w.text: Pho house, funky bar and music venue, Pho Cao is an eclectic hangout with a respectable menu of very good Vietnamese food including a large assortment of Pho dishes, bun bowls, rice dishes and appetizers. The spring rolls are a must try.   They give you the option of adding tarragon to any pho; exercise this option with caution.  I suggest trying the original dishes before modifications.   This was my second consecutive Halloween at Pho Cao enjoying the live music.  The staff is friendly,  the beer is cold and the food is excellent (superior to PT Noodle).

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Live music!

oQ3dMoXbibqsagrMomQ9hg.text: I recently switched jobs and I was in desperate need of a new local Pho joint.  I found this place by checking yelp to see what was close and thought I would give it a try.  When I first walked in I was very confused.  It seemed like I was walking in to an empty nightclub or just a regular hole in the wall bar.  Had a strange vibe for what I thought was a Pho joint.  I got their basic sliced beef pho with an order of spring rolls and an order of Thai Tea. You could tell that a couple of the bartenders or servers might have been new, but the service was still pretty good.   The Pho came out and the broth had a strange taste to it.  I couldn't quite place it but it had this weird after taste.  I added my usual toppings into it and it tasted a little better.  However, a good Pho restaurant should have a great basic broth.  They brought out the spring rolls and the single soggy piece of lettuce that was brought out with it was extremely disappointing.  I had to ask for more lettuce and was brought one single piece again??    All in all, not so sure i'll be visiting this place again and my search for a good Pho place by my new work has eluded me.

lbg5NEkZH5gBEDHM7J4HuQ.text: I've only been here twice.   The first time around, I was actually picking up a to-go order for my daughter, who was ill at that time.  The second time, we stopped by here after having spent nearly all day at the Scottsdale Pavilions doing indoor skydiving and go-karting.  It was open mic night, and there were a few performers exhibiting their guitar prowess.   To be honest, this place is a dive. If we dined here with that mindset, we wouldn't have had such an issue with the Pho that we had ordered.  We often sample a new Pho place each month; therefore, we are pretty well versed as to what to expect as far as texture and flavor.   However, we became very concerned with the actual texture of what was being passed as beef. It didn't look like real beef. And it didn't taste like real beef. It actually had the appearance of a frozen beef packet that was summarily boiled.  And the Pho itself didn't have the tangy flavor that we were accustomed to.   Couple that with the lack of utensils, and our inability to actually get the attention of a server that wasn't distracted by the event. It didn't make for a good impression regarding our dine-in experience.  I did give this place two stars because the local talent they had were actually quite entertaining and provided some levity from our dissatisfaction with both the food and the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pMkHdebQzCjjN_Pc3QCHvw.text: This place is so interesting definitely worth going to see what type of experience you will have. We showed up on a Friday night before the live music started. There were lots of people coming in to pick up orders, but not so many staying to actually dine here.   We sat at the bar and it wasn't the best experience. The guy working was new and still trying to figure things out, no big deal. They were out of the two drinks I wanted, so no happy hour for me. The food was good, so I could definitely see why there were so many people coming in just to grab take out. I tried the charbroiled pork and eggroll over vermicelli. My date had the ramen noodle pho. I think my dish was better.   Our server handed us the check halfway through the meal and asked us at least five times if we were ready to settle up. I honestly felt rushed and would have understood if the place was crowded and they needed the seats. There were three of us at the bar with room for eight and plenty of empty tables.  I liked the food, so I may go back?

3lQKDIEcfFMinDwSIlsTGQ.text: 2018 and I've hit the first pho spot that has sent me to the heavens, good lord...   First off: lunch special comes with 3 potstickers and a large bowl of pho. steal  Lucas, is a great server unique personality,   I'm probably coming back here before I leave please eat here

5h5MiDYNLdHdcc4xww4OXw.text: Is Pho Cao a dive? Is it a karaoke bar/club? Is it a Vietnamese restaurant with good food? Yes, yes and yes. I can see how there would be very mixed reviews of Pho Cao. We went for lunch, so there wasn't a band or any karaoke going on. If you went for dinner I can see how that might be annoying if you weren't expecting it. So go for lunch!  especially if you like quirky places.  Regardless, it is a little disorienting when you walk in from the bright sunlight to the darker windowless room and see the stage in front of you. It feels like an awesome place to drown your sorrows. While we didn't have any sorrows the day we were in, we did still have a beer and a cider.  Once we took a seat, the wait staff was great, and the food even better. We did not try the namesake pho, but had a rice noodle (bun) salad bowl, house fried rice and chicken curry. The rice noodle bowl was great. Chargrilled pork, shrimp and a crispy spring roll on lettuce, cucumber, carrots, herbs, and rice noodles with fish sauce- so good! The fried rice has chunks of that amazing dense Chinese sausage and an egg on top. It also came with two little chicken drumsticks that were nothing special. The chicken curry was just okay. A little too sweet, and tasted too much like the curry powder you buy at the grocery store. We'll definitely go back for the food. Not the karaoke. Believe me, no one wants to hear that! #tonedeaf 4 stars for food 3 for atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried rice with Chinese sausage, fried egg and chicken. Chicken curry in the background.
Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled pork rice noodle salad

ZVAoXLDtw5RDC5jVb_Sing.text: Nothing to write home about, your ok noodle house, it's a little too dark for me to be honest, no outside light coming in, service is a little slow, food was decent and little over priced for the quality of food

1JGvO8FFs5zRyeZzuErigQ.text: Wanna hear live music? Get drinks at a bar? Craving Vietnamese food? Well, do I have new for you, because this place does it all!    This place is so unique and funny. It's half bar and half a traditional Vietnamese restaurant. Critics will say that the place is indecisive of what the restaurant wants to be, but it honestly adds to the charm.   I came here for dinner one night, and the atmosphere is a little bleak when there isn't any music playing. The people they have performing were fun, and it made me enjoy my experience here! The food was alright. We got the fried calamari, and it was like, fried imitation crab sticks? I'm not really sure. I got the classic pho, and that was actually pretty good! A large bowl for a decent price.

WigyGncdbG_NkzfPVlBQ7Q.text: Pho Cao is undeniably a cool joint and, while it happened to be love at my first step into the restaurant, that doesn't mean it'll be everyone's joint. Pho Cao artfully blends the flavors of a Vietnamese restaurant (let's be honest, most of the restaurants have relatively boring decor and set-ups) with the, shall we say, charm of a dive bar, and packs in a stage for live music and karaoke to boot. The place does this without sacrificing service, as every time I've been, the wait staff has been quick and attentive. The pho I had was GIGANTIC but didn't sacrifice flavor and I look forward to going back.

ZmvwH3Bbko0XVKXLQ9gSEA.text: Absolutely LOVE the live music ! No matter what type of music it is, its always a pleasure! Me and my husband ordered the chicken Pho and egg rolls, by far the best pho I've had in Arizona, big pieces of chicken which I loved, the egg rolls were a delicate, the service was awesome! Our waiter was friendly and made sure we had everything we needed, I will be returning and sharing my experience with others:)

couh4MpjrvcTTBd5lEPSMA.text: First time here, had the fried spring rolls and the soft summer rolls which were good. Also the rice noodles w/beef and the special fried rice was delicious. The place was definitely a dive, a bar turned into a Vietnamese rstrnt., Very little natural lighting (lack of windows) there even was a pool table. Would I go back? Sure if in the neighborhood!!!

nm3lSfDnNHNOj54Fp3b-ig.text: I came with my mom on a weeknight and we both enjoyed our experience. The restaurant/bar/lounge/nightclub(?) is an interesting concept but the service and food here were good. We started with the shrimp spring rolls and both ordered pho, I ordered meatball and my mom ordered chicken. The veggies for $2 extra is totally worth it too- they give you a lot of nice broccoli, carrots and other assorted veggies. Good prices here too- I would come back.

4irrAXPSNtCVnsZs2jmqOg.text: Food was delicious but the after effects not so much. Both my son and I had nasty bubble guts. Shoulda stuck to my usual Pho place.

xbFVI-Y7sQ-inwSLTYSUmg.text: Best pho in town and killer atmosphere. I would happily write an extensive review written exclusively using pho puns but I'm too drunk thanks to the strong drinks and dope servers, especially Chris.

H-hhqYP3-ge5RWLn9oYkuQ.text: Ordered the Vietnamese Sandwich, spring rolls (not fried), and seafood  Pho  which were  flavorful (broth is well made). Friendly staff, and quick service.

O1mNiQJOqTfVKwMRJNERGg.text: Good food. Great atmosphere. And the pho is great. Fast service and not over priced. I'd recommend this place to anyone

cERPMe8fSM3aQ-l8qZS9Hg.text: Good and friendly service. The food was ok, I think the meat didn't taste as fresh as I expected, it had this "it's been frozen" aftertaste. But overall it had a good seasoning. I would recommend it to friends. Three stars is good.

dZV5UIQCsahhNYkWXvymrQ.text: They do a great job at this place I go there at least once or twice a week.  Soup is good and they have coconut here.  I don't have to drive to north Phoenix for good pho.

otNTlWjvz-_c7Eee9ecHTg.text: Just went to this place the food was really good and the staff was very friendly.  I ordered the ramen dish with a side of white rice. The food was served in less than 10 minutes and was super hot.

V9hD9iICz-fxfGLYNctLYg.text: I sat here over 20 minutes before anyone asked me can I help you..... Bad customer service!

4nd7t5C-M00UUkdYcElgag.text: The worst service I have ever had when I went to this place today. Previously had great experiences today was hell. Blake was my waiter and I pray for the customers he has after me today. Asked for hot tea. Brought tea mug and brought it over so carelessly there was hot water all over the plate. It dumped down my leg. After that the refill was the same way. Asked about spring rolls said I don't eat pork. He recommended the first one with pork. Then repeated I don't eat pork recommended the only other one on there with pork in it so settled on the spider ones and made my own non pork decision. Brought out 2 entrees to the customers I was with. Mine never came out. Double checked what was going on assured it was on the way. My pho never came. Walked over to kitchen after long wait and asked him to box it to go with noodles separate and all components separate . Noodles in my broth and all the meat. Asked and paid for extra meat, got 2 extra prices of shrimp no extra meat. Majority of ingredients not on side so noodles Super soggy and gross by the time I got home to eat. Icing on the cake the bill was $68.50 I gave him $100 he brought me back 30$ while explaining and I quote " I couldn't find another 1.50$ so here is 30 back sorry about that. I left no tip and will not return. Worst waiter and service ever. Worst to go ever.

SEsHeu3tmP12JD6veKs1JQ.text: Awesome pho ! But music was just a little bit too loud, was hard to have a conversation with my boyfriend,

oH39VIGGZ3NLSeU1kgBfUQ.text: Like the food, but hate the karaoke. Still, it's a worthwhile tradeoff for late-night Vietnamese.

Qf6IUhCjRuJTrHphjfeTJw.text: Walked in, ordered drinks, apparently it was the owner working the bar, who then wandered off to the office. After 10 minutes, reordered again after I realized the owner wasn't coming back. Hung out for an hour,  went to close my tab, found out they gave my credit card to someone else...no apologies.  Spent the next 20 minutes outside on the phone with the bank canceling my card, came back in to tell my friends 'goodbye', at which point the owner called me over to give him another credit card to pay for my drinks they had no track of...wtf? Not making this up.  I avoid writing bad reviews since service or food might be off for the night due to uncontrollable circumstances, acts of God, or someone is just having a bad day...but this interaction directly involved the owner, so there is no way to justify this.  Enjoy your bad review and the $40 tab Pho Cao. If I could have given you negative stars and Worst Shithole of the Year, I would have...Avoid this shithole.

VZNqwaYjO43A96jaxwXj7Q.text: great price and excellent service   tried chicken pho delicious !!

rLJ4D-KPVLu0TD44MuaILw.text: I tried ordering with them online through yelp, out of no where I have multiple charges coming from San Francisco for uber and numerous things DO NOT use your card with this place because it looks like they're trying to do some carding fraud it may not be the owner but it's definitely a employee or something pay cash

Cbx3E88mgJYTJ0TIp5wBwA.text: Not really the standard pho place. It's a great place if you also want to hear live bands. Our last experience was great with a few new singers, amazing talent. Food is really good, the large bowl is quite large so my husband always orders the small and is full. Recommend trying the spring rolls and combination pho, it only comes in the large bowl so be hungry when you order.

p5zYDWE43m4OD2fxaUdcew.text: If I had to describe this oriental eatery in one word, it would be atrocious. The service, the cuisine, and the atmosphere made me wish I had no taste buds, ears, or senses of any kind. I came with 3 tantalizing young women, who were promptly cat called by a cretin on the way in. Granted, they were all drop dead gorgeous, but they were not impressed. Upon entering this pathetic excuse for an establishment, we were distraught to see that 2 heathens were playing guitar and singing folk tunes on the restaurant's incredibly loud speakers. Imagine the worst voice you've ever heard in your life. Then imagine a worse voice than that one. We were subjected to the previously mentioned voice crooning horrific show tunes for well over half an hour. We had nowhere to run. Nowhere to hide. We were prisoners of this deplorable human and he got off to our anguish. If you see Pho Cao on the way home from work on a sleep Sunday afternoon, turn around. Drive. Drive fast. Drive until you reach the ocean. Then start swimming. If there is a hell, I've been there. It is Pho Cao.

6wGr4BwWLN8lgmwL2uqV3g.text: Very good food. Environment is not your typical pho joint. It's a bar that does live music, and has covers charged on occasion. Which I personally find annoying. My meal is $10 and the cover just to sit is $5? No thank you. I suggest getting your order to go. Calling ahead is fast and they are very good about getting your food out to you once you get there. Servers and service is good and very friendly. I will be back for the pho but not the live music.

Q9Mnp0mMT8ztalcC0xuvVA.text: I enjoyed this place so much! I went with my girlfriend to this place last night and we really enjoyed it because there was a LIVE performance by a few local artists. Very simple.

ZYI9OaeraTmbSf9Z6lw4dA.text: Cool little spot. Went with friends on a Thursday night for some pho and had a wonderful time. I had immediate flashbacks when pulling into the parking lot. Took me back about 10 years to when it was a hookah bar. Time flies. Fast. The food is good; I am new to the pho/ramen thing and am loving every single minute. Delicious. Thursday night is karaoke night. Fun times. Of course there are the few show offs, just like it is at any karaoke night. But who am I to judge them for spending their whole entire week prepping for this? Hog that mic dude singing Whitney Houston, I'm not drunk enough anyway. ;)

ut7kYMJWX2pZXtsbvo_Ovw.text: This place is the MUTHA-PHO-CAO! We came here on a whim since I've been craving pho. My boyfriend was very hesitant to eat here but decided "happy wife..happy life". Boy wasn't he happy after he finished devouring the Mongolian beef! I had the pho tai and potstickers. This place definitely has great potential for a late night night cap that's close to home.

_YMQGzdO4xsH4sAnclKv9g.text: This is the best Pho in Scottsdale hands down!  I love the spicy tamarind option as no one makes their broth spicy enough.  We are repeat customers and will continue to do so.

DYJJ2yj0RrQufi5guh7Q4A.text: Fun place.  Went there for the first with a couple friends on a Thurs. night for karaoke and some drinks.  We generally go to various karaoke bars in the east valley and wanted to give this one a shot.  Crowd was definitely a 20's crowd, however I think there was a special celebration going on that night that brought in the big group.    Phil does karaoke on Thurs nights there and he always does a great job.  Drink prices were reasonable but nothing to brag about.  Will probably venture back there again.

lOP9SG3YHn2VrPOcNCFw8w.text: there was a reunion party thing going on for a group of people in their 50s-70s when we arrived for dinner. we also had no clue that it was some sort of ktv/restaurant hybrid but were still down to give it a shot. the open-room ktv was kind of distracting, so we choice to eat outside but a bunch of them were smoking/talking really loud so it was a lose-lose situation lol.  we ordered the fresh coconut, a coke, and 2 phos. the coconut was the only thing that went right (but how can you mess that up when you just have to crack it open). the soda was flat, and the noodles that came in the broth were still FROZEN and they made no effort to boil it before putting it in or at least giving it more time before serving it. the broth was tasteless as well and we both left after taking a few bites.

S77BkHwEl8uAfuVHyYGwYg.text: Who would have guessed, a Vietnamese food sports bar.  And the food is really good.  Authentic and fresh.  I'll be back for sure.

fEBt6eTIutTqKx9n_7FICg.text: I really like this place, I've had it a dozen or so times and this place never disappoints!

72ZYSiqDx8Y8NsP2is7z9g.text: Very excited I came to this place. I gotta admit I went around 2 in the afternoon and there were Almost no cars in the parking lot and the building is pretty skeptical from the outside, but I thought hey why not!  Pho with chicken and added veggies, my bowl came out super fast and overflowing with goodies inside! I was so busy enjoying the broth, veggies and meat I almost forgot about the noodles!  Can't wait to come again!!  **I come here every week, now**

M-Bod6LVLKeoYLLEeNwt9A.text: Great service. Bomb Pho!!! Always my favorite go to food when I'm just hungry and not craving anything...

HPpHliY4CcjUEqZXfy7zng.text: I moved so I haven't been there recently. I heard they recently moved too. I'm planning a trip out there soon because I miss their pho thai bowls, Banh mi sandwiches, and thai teas. Can't wait!  UPDATE: I went there on Friday 5/5/17 and had a very disappointing and negative experience. My roomate and I were in the area. So, we stopped by for an early dinner around 5pm. The place was completely empty. We walk in and sit ourselves in a booth. After a few minutes, a waitress comes out and comes by to our table to take our orders. We both order two Thai iced teas and some appetizers: fried calamari, and an order or spring rolls, which we shared. The calamari were very different than I'm used to at any other restaurant. But, not bad. The disappointing and strange part is that they were served with a side of shrimp cocktail sauce  (unoriginal). We were both starving at that point, so we both scarfed down the appetizers and waited for our dinner entrees. I ordered a bowl of Pho soup (regular size #6) and my roomate ordered a chicken curry dish.  I guess I should have paid attention that my pho was not steaming hot as it normally is served. But, like I said before, we were starving. Right after our dinner we both started to feel overly full. Which is somewhat normal after eating a bowl of pho. But the strange part is that after we got home, I noticed that my stomach felt upset even 4 hrs after. I took some Pepto to soothe my stomach upset. A little while later, I would spend the rest of the night and part of the next morning vomiting the entire contents of my stomach. Which was everything I had for dinner. I had a bad case of food poisoning!  I had not felt that sick and horrible after eating anywhere in years. As far as I can recall, I had only had food poisoning once before. And the symptoms were pretty similar. Either the cook or the kitchen is operating under unhealthy sanitary conditions, or the soup was not cooked to proper temperature to prevent someone from getting sick.  Either way,  I can no longer recommend this restaurant to anyone. Sad. Because I had been there several times before without incident.   BEWARE: If you have the pho soup here, make sure it's piping hot! And still, eat at your own risk. Sorry Victor. Maybe it is just the cook. Either way, heads up on checking that the kitchen is operating to proper food handling/preparation standards. I'm sorry I had to give you a bad review.  I just don't want anyone else getting as sick as I did.

yABUMLtOQy0ITz_w1ynfBg.text: I had a bartender follow me out on Friday night and accuse me of not tipping and continued to question why I didn't. Which I did! I had tipped her 20%. I honestly do not wish to go back because of the way she had treated us. Thanks again!

ABAql8_QH5ioRt9sNKL4sg.text: Easy, seamless ordering through yelp's online service. Order was confirmed within 10 min and set to be ready 10 min after that. There was a short wait when we got there for pickup, but the staff was apologetic and did their best to hurry things along. Minus 1 star for the amount of chicken in the Pho Ga (seemed a little skimpy) but the broth was incredible and the overall taste profile knocked it out of the park. We will certainly be going back, and may even do dine in to check out some of their live music.

_1Opdads4hENhJlVTqi4wQ.text: I think our expectations were a little different than what we got.  This place is not so much a restaurant as it is everything else. It's a bar, it's a lounge, it's a live music venue. The menu is plentiful....plenty of asian cuisine, including Pho. But there's a pool table and a stage. And a musician performing an extensively long sound check. Once the band started, we ate as fast as we could not because the music was bad, but because it was too damn loud for us to hear each other talk! The service had much to be desired. Our server, very young, had no idea what several of the menu items were when we asked questions about them. But instead of offering to ask the cook, he just stood there with his hands in his pockets saying "Um, you know, I really don't know what that is".....well....GO FIND OUT! And I don't know if you've ever been the last to finish your food, but normally, the server leaves some plates. But instead of just letting us rest a bit, he was trying to take away our plates that still had food on them, and even while one of us was still eating, he asked if we wanted a to go box for her meal, and put the check out. At waffle house, sure...but we just expected a bit better.  My clay pot with crunchy rice was anything but crunchy. It was basically steamed rice, beneath a layer of steamed vegetables with some thick sweet sauce poured on top of it. Not tasty at all.  Anyway, we tried and we disliked.

KEhEaL-1y6Esq_KPQKRRSg.text: My favorite place for spring rolls! The pho is yummy too. I usually prefer to get take out.

dyFmLQreuLeKAg4mLMizew.text: Walked in and saw/heard karaoke...absolutely just took this from a 4 star to a 5 star. Pho with spicy tamarind broth was excellent, comes with massive amount of sides and vegetables were incredibly fresh. Wasn't expecting to have a good local pho place down the street, but I'll now be back for sure

PJGLEwTiVtOI1wfY4X8olg.text: Excellent food, I order out a lot and they always get it right. It's alittle pricey but it's the best! Always  fun to see the live bands when we have the time and not on the take out "go". Thanks again!

CxFfTDBdpujJgCssj8fxMg.text: There's nothing like a piping hot bowl of pho! My favorite thing on the menu is definitely the steak and meatball pho. I get it every time I come here along with the spring rolls.   Great atmosphere and a good staff. I've been here several times now and can say that wont change anytime soon. The food always comes out fairly quickly and never disappoints! I love that this place has a bar and has a fairly decent drink menu with good prices. Sake bombers are a must, I always get them when I come here.   Perfect location for a weekend date or just to catch up with friends. Don't pass this place up, it will not disappoint!

nZej9HTO7LKIytnwsj2psQ.text: Pho Cao is more than food. Victor is an amazing human and we always love being in the restaurant. Their menu is extensive, my boyfriend and I are about as opposite as you can get in terms of taste in food and we always find multiple things to try at Pho Cao. Thanks for always supporting local music, and filling our bellies with delicious food!!

xxqrbNU2XonFXKffWU3OVg.text: Place is just a dive surprisingly how good it looks on the outside. Pretty dark and grungy indoors. Food is just ok, could have more flavor. Curry seemed like it was watered down. Service is mediocre. There is definitely better Pho around Scottsdale to go after.

ldwZh40dFf4jEvUzj4gQnw.text: It seems like this place is trying to make it work, but it's barely working...  I got the surf and turf Pho and I got 2 pieces of beef and 2 pieces of shrimp for 9$, I'm not impressed. His was the house rice and it looked like a pile of mush!  Staff was attentive and friendly...  Don't over charge the customer so you can afford a space as big as a warehouse!

7D1v4JtClCXIMp2aysygAQ.text: It's a little hole in the wall but the food is delicious, great service, amazing atmosphere with music and a pool table.

p-EKSHLyQECEKN24t1cmCg.text: Atmosphere is cool , they had a band. Felt bad for our waitress ,seemed understaffed. Food came out quickly and was deliciouuuuuus We ordered the pineapple fried rice and ramen pho. Definitely recommend  , would like to come on a Thursday for karaoke night

7-sL-QEfVtr7SjJ8cIwL3A.text: I stopped by for lunch for job I worked nearby.   First of all, the service was impeccable---I was in a bit of a time crunch, so I informed the hostess and both she and my waiter were prompt and made sure I was done by the time requested. Additionally, I asked for Boba and, despite it not being on the menu, the kitchen prepared a cup. They didn't have the wide straws, but I was nevertheless impressed by their willingness to accommodate me.   The Pho itself is the reason I chose not to give five stars. It's flavor was above average: The broth was rich and robust. The noodles appear to have sat dry for a few minutes too many, as they were clumped together. I attribute it to the lack of a much rush, so it isn't a fatal flaw.   All in all, Pho Cao exceeded expectations for a nightclub-esque noodle shop. I'll be back for more Pho and the puns that came with it.

WL0ySqXFf_z46hZwv1ktmg.text: Not the best pho. Buttt the bright side is it is open late and is he only pho restaurant around phx metro area open till 2am on some nights. I don't like that it is a pho bar because associating cigarette smell with your pho is kinda off putting. The staff has always been super nice though.

5xDA83d3PolrwotLOf_ylg.text: This pho is soooo delicious! The atmosphere is a little too grungy for me tho. The only reason it's getting three stars is because an hour for soup and 20 mins for a drink is a little too much. The waiter was panicked the entire time. Maybe more servers would make the experience better for everyone. GREAT food tho. Highly recommend for a snack or a first date. The server will definitely leave you alone.

VxSZPBMieq8Ti5clfLThXw.text: I got the large P5 spicy and it was great! I'm a big fan of Pho. The only place that beats this place is SHADY PARK on Mill Ave in Tempe.   The reason I gave this place a 4 star is because the interior definitely needs an update. Looks like a dive bar and then some lol. Other then that food and service was on point!!   I most definitely will eat here again!

EU_Y6V0avzx8p92gUhbAEQ.text: Let me start by saying that we have been here a few times before and their pho is very good. BUT tonight i really wanted pho and we don't get out of work til 9 so i was excited to see when we checked their hours that they were open til 1030. We got there at about 925 and walked in and we're told they were actually closed. I said "aren't you guys open til 1030?" and she responded "oh ya, we are closing up early tonight...." We drove out of the way to go there and it was just really unprofessional.  If you have a set time that your establishment closes, how can you just decide to shut it down early if you have people coming in seeking service? At least lock the damn door then. Douche...

LBm_jWEerwmi-fWKT4oZ-A.text: This place sucks!!!!! I never tried pho and this first time was disappointing. The taste was so bad I didn't even finish my bowl. Waisted money and on top of that I got fried rice on the side and the rice was also disgusting. Wow never going back !!!!!!!!!

IvG4u0f0zMKs5k-sFK_yFw.text: Food was okay, I would like to go back and order something else, wasn't a huge fan of my meal.  Service was lukewarm, but they did have a live singer that night, so I was hoping it was due to the noise level.

Td1DrTHZUJaTBAfabwOOig.text: If I could give a negative star, I would.  Dirty/dark old bar. Ordered Saki, glass were filthy and dingy. Menu prices are higher than the online price lists. Owner had excuses to give his staff, but wouldn't come out and speak with us.  We eat Pho weekly, in Seattle.  This was disgusting and an embarrassment to anything Pho. Even the waitress said she prefers eating Pho anywhere else.  I would never return or recommend this place to anyone!

eivj8rbnigq6gk-Y_0onkw.text: The environment isn't your standard Vietnamese restaurant. It's kind of a dive bar which I think is kind of cool. Food here is really good. We came when they opened and they had some really good specials going on. We ordered their pho and it's really yummy. For a regular size is good enough for me. They have 2 bowl sizes. One is 40oz and 50oz. I felt full after an eggroll, potsticker, and pho. The egg rolls were really good but didn't like the sauce that much. Price wise wasn't bad but could be cheaper. Overall, I'll come again. Nice place!

RzOji8tDQoFivyZU-RD52A.text: I was torn between four and five stars. For some reason I expected a place that looked all nice and beautiful on the inside and the food would be mediocre. But it was the exact opposite. When I walked into the place I was surprised how plain it was and almost resembled a dive bar.  But then everything changed. Our server was very good with the menu and had several recommendations and was extremely helpful.  The food was very tasty and the pineapple fried rice was outstanding.    It will probably end up being one of my go to places because the price was right for outstanding food.. I'm not as concerned about the cheap bar decor. It was just a bit of an odd experience.

Z1uY8nh5OZD9XJzt9wikyA.text: Tasty pho that is complex in flavor. Other great options are the wings, curry and summer rolls. Service is consistent and attentive. Locale features rotation of strong local acts like Sugar Thieves, The Effects and many others, plus radio broadcast highlighting bands. Highly recommend this place. Make it a point to put this place on your radar.

Dq3dY9T1rscjYGJoacSqkQ.text: Okay, so I finally get to this. After experiencing the "basement" of past Pho Cao, I was so happy to see they have moved on up to the Northeast side. The night we went they had live music, the Pho was good, and the service shined. I wish people wouldn't bring their screaming toddlers to places that serve a lot of alcohol. The place was loaded with whiners and criers. But food was good and that's why we came.

LlYIsgUV7o8YB59W0y3K7g.text: Extremely disappointed, tonight is the last night time I will ever give this place money. We placed an order through Postmates for crispy rolls, 2 chicken phos and a side of rice, got charged around $33 for everything. We received our food and noticed they forgot 1 of the phos. Mind you this happens constantly at Pho Cao and we're always having to drive back for something they forgot. Anyway, we called to tell them they forgot 1 pho and like any business with good customer service they would acknowledge their mistake and try to fix the situation, that was the complete opposite here. The OWNER started getting very angry and arguing on the phone about how it's Postmates fault and we need to call them when clearly it wasn't, we then said we had no problem driving over to get the 1 pho they forgot and he just continued to argue with us and be rude. After about 10 minutes of the OWNER being extremely unprofessional and extremely rude we told him we will not be going to his establishment any longer and hung up. There are plenty of good places that serve great pho that don't have owners who are crooks.

PhczU5gZKd53n2h_-bWuNw.text: Upon walking into Pho Cao I immediately felt the dive bar atmosphere as has been pointed out previously, with music playing a bit too loudly for my taste. However, it felt cool and the employees were really friendly, my server also knew his menu well.   I ordered the Spider Crab Spring Roll (Goi Cuon Cua Lot), Fried Chicken Dumplings (Ha Cao Chien), and the Ramen Noodle Pho. The softshell crab was my favorite, felt really fresh and healthy. The ramen pho was also good, but nothing special. I was kinda disappointed over the dumplings, the consistency of the chicken was a bit bland and the overall dumpling was doughy. Finally, the price was kinda steep. Therefore I give the whole experience 3-stars.    Although the food wasn't great, I would come back to one of their nightly events. As I wrote previously, the staff were friendly and I felt the atmosphere was cool. They organize open mic nights, karaoke, and have live performances. So that's definetly something to check out!

Photo of Pho Cao - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ramen Noodle Pho with extra meatballs

HWnUlhfmQ7e2OJMexmhCiQ.text: As soon as I walked into this place I knew there was no way I was going to order food. There are many small Vietnamese restaurants that sell better food for cheaper. Every thing about the place reeked of Scottsdale dive-ness.   The dance floor is a tiny space that is cordoned off by some wood railings. The floor is the same dirty tile that covers the rest of the place.   When I arrived on a Saturday night the floor was a mosh pit of young lower class Scottsdale hipsters. It was body to body, standing room barely, and people were allowed to carry booze onto the floor. People were pressing through the tables in an attempt to crowd into the tiny mosh pit. No way I was even going to try to dance there!  I would give the place a 1 star but they do deserve credit for having a lot of live music.
